recipes.name: Slow Cooker Garlic Brown Sugar Glazed Chicken
ingredients: 1 (3-4 lb) whole chicken, cut into serving pieces
Cooked rice or noodles, for serving
directions: Step 1: Place chicken pieces in the slow cooker.
Step 2: In a medium bowl, whisk together brown sugar, vinegar, Sprite or 7-Up, minced garlic, soy sauce, black pepper, and cayenne pepper (if using).
Step 3: Pour the mixture over the chicken in the slow cooker.
Step 4: Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until chicken is cooked through and tender.

Step 5: If desired, thicken the sauce:  Remove about 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid from the slow cooker and whisk in the cornstarch until smooth. Return the mixture to the slow cooker and cook for another 15-20 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
Step 6: Serve the chicken hot over rice or noodles, spooning the sauce over top.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a slow cooker garlic brown sugar glazed chicken, glistening with a rich, dark sauce, served over fluffy white rice. Use a dark, rustic wooden background and a shallow depth of field, focusing on a succulent chicken thigh. Incorporate scattered cloves of roasted garlic and fresh green onion sprigs as garnish. Employ soft, natural lighting from the side to highlight the texture of the chicken skin and the sheen of the sauce. Aim for a warm, inviting mood with a slightly overhead angle showcasing both the chicken and the accompanying rice.

video_script.title: Slow Cooker Garlic Brown Sugar Glazed Chicken
video_script.description: Learn how to make tender, flavorful garlic brown sugar glazed chicken in your slow cooker. This easy recipe is perfect for a weeknight meal.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of finished slow cooker garlic brown sugar glazed chicken served over rice, garnished with chopped green onions.  Focus on the glistening glaze and tender chicken.
scenes.text: Slow Cooker Garlic Brown Sugar Glazed Chicken
scenes.voice_over: Craving a delicious and effortless meal? Look no further than this slow cooker garlic brown sugar glazed chicken! Tender, juicy chicken coated in a sweet and savory glaze, it's the perfect weeknight dinner.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: whole chicken cut into pieces, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, Sprite, garlic, soy sauce, black pepper, cayenne pepper, cornstarch, and a bowl of cooked rice.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: a whole chicken cut into pieces, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, Sprite or 7-Up, minced garlic, soy sauce, black pepper, and a touch of cayenne for a little kick.  We'll also use cornstarch for thickening and serve it over rice.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken pieces being placed in the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: First, place the chicken pieces in your slow cooker.

scenes.image_prompt: Brown sugar, vinegar, Sprite, garlic, soy sauce, pepper, and cayenne being whisked together in a bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a medium bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, Sprite, minced garlic, soy sauce, black pepper, and cayenne pepper, if using.

scenes.image_prompt: The glaze mixture being poured over the chicken in the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the glaze over the chicken, ensuring it's evenly coated.

scenes.image_prompt: Slow cooker with the lid on.
scenes.voice_over: Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and tender.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of cornstarch being whisked into cooking liquid from slow cooker
scenes.voice_over: For a thicker sauce, remove about half a cup of the cooking liquid and whisk in two tablespoons of cornstarch until smooth. Return the mixture to the slow cooker and cook for another 15-20 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Finished slow cooker garlic brown sugar glazed chicken served over a bed of rice, garnished with green onions, with a spoon pouring extra sauce on top.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious slow cooker garlic brown sugar glazed chicken hot over rice or noodles, spooning that irresistible sauce over top. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use dark brown sugar.
If you don't have Sprite or 7-Up, you can substitute ginger ale or another lemon-lime soda.
Bone-in, skin-on chicken pieces will result in a more flavorful dish.
Shred the chicken and use it for tacos, sandwiches, or salads.

recipes.name: Szechuan Noodles with Spicy Beef Sauce
directions: Step 1: Brown the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat, breaking it up with a spoon. Drain off any excess fat and set aside.
Step 2: Heat the sesame oil in the same skillet over medium heat.
Step 3: Add the chopped onions, minced garlic, minced ginger, and crushed red pepper to the skillet. Sauté for 5-7 minutes, or until the onions are softened.
Step 4: In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and beef broth until smooth.
Step 5: Pour the cornstarch mixture, hoisin sauce, and soy sauce into the skillet with the vegetables. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Step 6: Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 minute, or until the sauce has thickened.
Step 7: Add the cooked ground beef to the sauce and stir to combine.
Step 8: Add the cooked vermicelli noodles to the skillet and toss to coat with the sauce.
Step 9: Garnish with sliced green onions and serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant, close-up overhead shot of Szechuan noodles with spicy beef sauce, showcasing the rich texture of the sauce clinging to the noodles. Use dark slate or wood backdrop with natural, slightly diffused side lighting to emphasize the glistening sauce and steam rising from the dish. Garnish with chopped scallions and sesame seeds. Shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on the beef and noodles in the foreground, with a subtly blurred background. Aim for a warm, inviting mood with rich, saturated colors that highlight the dish's spiciness. Include simple, elegant chopsticks resting on the side.

video_script.title: Szechuan Noodles with Spicy Beef Sauce
video_script.description: Learn to make this easy and flavorful Szechuan noodle dish with a rich and spicy beef sauce. Perfect for a weeknight dinner!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished plate of Szechuan noodles with spicy beef sauce, garnished with green onions. Steam rising from the dish. Focus on the vibrant colors and textures.
scenes.text: Szechuan Noodles with Spicy Beef Sauce
scenes.voice_over: Craving a flavorful and easy meal? These Szechuan noodles with a rich and spicy beef sauce are perfect for a quick weeknight dinner. Let's get started!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden cutting board. Group related ingredients together: ground beef, onions, garlic, ginger, crushed red pepper, sesame oil, cornstarch, beef broth, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, cooked vermicelli noodles, and green onions.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: ground beef, onions, garlic, ginger, crushed red pepper for heat, sesame oil, cornstarch, beef broth, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, cooked vermicelli noodles, and green onions for garnish.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of ground beef browning in a skillet over medium-high heat. A spoon breaking up the beef.
scenes.voice_over: First, brown the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Make sure to break it up with a spoon. Once cooked, drain off any excess fat and set the beef aside.

scenes.image_prompt: The same skillet with sesame oil heating up. Onions, garlic, ginger, and crushed red pepper being added to the skillet.
scenes.voice_over: In the same skillet, heat the sesame oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions, minced garlic, minced ginger, and crushed red pepper. Sauté for 5-7 minutes, until the onions soften.

scenes.image_prompt: A small bowl with cornstarch and beef broth being whisked together until smooth.
scenes.voice_over: In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and beef broth until you get a smooth mixture. This will thicken our sauce beautifully.

scenes.image_prompt: The cornstarch mixture, hoisin sauce, and soy sauce being poured into the skillet. The mixture coming to a boil and thickening.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the cornstarch mixture, hoisin sauce, and soy sauce into the skillet with the vegetables. Stir constantly and bring it to a boil. Then, reduce the heat to low and simmer for about a minute until the sauce thickens.

scenes.image_prompt: The cooked ground beef being added back to the skillet and stirred into the sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Add the cooked ground beef back to the skillet and stir it into the sauce, making sure everything is well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Cooked vermicelli noodles being added to the skillet and tossed to coat with the sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Add the cooked vermicelli noodles to the skillet and toss everything together until the noodles are completely coated with that delicious sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished plate of Szechuan noodles with spicy beef sauce, garnished with green onions. Chopsticks picking up a portion of noodles.
scenes.voice_over: Garnish with sliced green onions, and serve immediately.  These noodles are best enjoyed hot! This recipe is packed with flavor and has about 450 calories, 30 grams of protein, 50 grams of carbs, and 20 grams of fat per serving.

cooking_tips: Adjust the amount of crushed red pepper flakes to control the level of spiciness.
For a richer flavor, use low-sodium beef broth.
If the sauce becomes too thick, add a little more beef broth to thin it out.
Garnish with chopped peanuts or toasted sesame seeds for added texture and flavor.

recipes.name: Almost White Castle Sliders
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 400°F.
2. In a large bowl, combine ground chuck, onion soup mix, egg, pepper, water, and breadcrumbs. Mix well.
3. Press the beef mixture into an ungreased 10x15 inch jelly roll pan.
4. Prick the surface of the meatloaf with a fork.
5. Bake for 10 minutes.
6. Drain off excess grease.
7. Let the meatloaf cool completely.
8. Cut the cooled meatloaf into 24 equal squares.
9. Place each meat square onto a dinner roll.
10. Combine mustard and ketchup in a small bowl and spread on the bottom bun of each slider.
11. Top with pickles and cheese, if desired.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stack of three Almost White Castle Sliders on a distressed metal baking sheet, with a few scattered, loose pickles and a vintage mustard bottle in the background.  Focus sharply on the foreground slider, showcasing the textured beef patty, melted cheese, and pickle peeking out from the soft bun. Use warm, diffused lighting to emphasize the golden hues of the bun and cheese, creating a comforting, nostalgic mood.  Employ a shallow depth of field to blur the background elements slightly.  Shoot from a slightly elevated, three-quarters angle to reveal the layers of each slider and create visual depth.

video_script.title: Almost White Castle Sliders
video_script.description: These sliders taste just like White Castle! Perfect for a quick and easy meal or satisfying a late night craving.

scenes.image_prompt: Close up of several finished Almost White Castle sliders, stacked on a plate, with dill pickle slices and melted cheese. Steam rising from the sliders, indicating they're fresh and hot. Focus on the texture and delicious appearance of the sliders.
scenes.voice_over: Craving White Castle but don't want to leave the house? These Almost White Castle Sliders are the perfect solution! Easy to make and packed with flavor, they're perfect for any occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Display of ingredients neatly arranged on a table. Show the ground beef, onion soup mix, egg, pepper, water, and breadcrumbs in separate bowls. Focus on the ingredients themselves to highlight their freshness and quality.
scenes.voice_over: For these sliders, you'll need ground chuck, an envelope of onion soup mix, an egg, black pepper, water, breadcrumbs, and of course, slider buns. Optional toppings include American cheese slices and dill pickle slices.  For the sauce, we'll need ketchup and yellow mustard.

scenes.image_prompt: Mixing bowl, with ground chuck, onion soup mix, egg, pepper, water, and breadcrumbs being combined. A hand using a fork or spatula to mix ingredients until just combined. Close-up of the beef mixture.
scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, combine the ground chuck, onion soup mix, egg, pepper, water, and breadcrumbs. Mix everything until just combined. Be careful not to overmix.

scenes.image_prompt: A person pressing the beef mixture into an ungreased 10x15 inch jelly roll pan. The mixture should be evenly distributed in the pan.
scenes.voice_over: Press the beef mixture into an ungreased 10x15 inch jelly roll pan. Prick the surface with a fork.

scenes.image_prompt: The meatloaf baking in a preheated oven at 400°F. Display timer showing 10 minutes. Steam coming from the oven.
scenes.voice_over: Bake in a preheated oven at 400°F for 10 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Tilting a jelly roll pan over a bowl or sink to drain off excess grease. Close up of the grease being discarded.
scenes.voice_over: Drain off any excess grease and let the meatloaf cool completely before cutting.

scenes.image_prompt: Cutting the cooled meatloaf into 24 equal squares using a knife. Show the neatly cut squares of meatloaf.
scenes.voice_over: Once cooled, cut the meatloaf into 24 equal squares.

scenes.image_prompt: Placing each meat square onto the bottom bun of a slider roll.
scenes.voice_over: Place each meat square onto a slider roll. Mix ketchup and mustard and spread it on the bottom bun.

scenes.image_prompt: Finished sliders stacked on a plate with dill pickle slices and melted cheese. Some sliders are shown cut in half to visualize the inside, including the cheese and pickle.
scenes.voice_over: Top with pickles and cheese, if desired. These sliders are great on their own, or serve with your favorite sides like fries or onion rings. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use ground beef with a higher fat content.
To make cleanup easier, line the jelly roll pan with parchment paper.
If desired, toast the buns lightly before assembling the sliders.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore
ingredients: 3 lbs boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
directions: Step 1: Place the sliced onions in the bottom of the slow cooker.
Step 2: Add the chicken pieces on top of the onions.
Step 3: In a medium bowl, combine the tomato paste, mushrooms, green bell pepper, minced garlic, oregano, basil, celery powder, salt, white wine, olive oil, and red pepper flakes (if using).
Step 4: Pour the combined ingredients over the chicken in the slow cooker.
Step 5: Cover and cook on low heat for 7-9 hours, or on high heat for 3-4 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Step 6: Serve hot over cooked pasta or rice.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a rustic, inviting image of Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore. Focus on the tender chicken pieces nestled amongst the rich tomato sauce, onions, mushrooms, and peppers in a shallow, earthenware bowl. Use warm, natural light from the side to highlight the texture of the chicken and the vibrant colors of the vegetables. A shallow depth of field should emphasize the saucy chicken in the foreground, with a slightly blurred background featuring a scattering of fresh oregano leaves and a crusty loaf of bread. The overall mood should be warm, comforting, and appetizing.  Employ a slightly overhead, angled shot to showcase the dish's depth and richness.

video_script.title: Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore
video_script.description: A comforting and flavorful Italian classic made easy in your slow cooker.

scenes.voice_over: Craving a warm, hearty meal with minimal effort? Look no further! Today, we're making Slow Cooker Chicken Cacciatore, a rich and flavorful Italian classic perfect for busy weeknights.

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: boneless, skinless chicken thighs, onion, tomato paste, mushrooms, green bell pepper, garlic, oregano, basil, celery powder, salt, white wine, olive oil, and optionally, some red pepper flakes for a touch of heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Sliced onions being placed in the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: Start by placing the sliced onions at the bottom of your slow cooker.  This will create a flavorful base for the chicken.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken thighs being placed on top of the onions in the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: Next, add the chicken thighs on top of the onions, distributing them evenly.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients for the sauce (tomato paste, mushrooms, green bell pepper, garlic, oregano, basil, celery powder, salt, white wine, olive oil, and red pepper flakes) being combined in a bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a medium bowl, combine the tomato paste, mushrooms, green bell pepper, minced garlic, oregano, basil, celery powder, salt, white wine, olive oil, and red pepper flakes if you're using them.

scenes.image_prompt: The sauce being poured over the chicken and onions in the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the combined ingredients over the chicken in the slow cooker, ensuring the chicken is well coated.

scenes.image_prompt: Slow cooker lid being placed on top.
scenes.voice_over: Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 7-9 hours, or on high for 3-4 hours. The chicken is done when it's cooked through and easily shreds.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Creamy Potato Chowder
ingredients: 8 cups russet potatoes, peeled and diced
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
8 ounces cream cheese, cubed and softened
directions: Step 1: Combine the potatoes, onion, chicken broth, and cream of chicken soup in a slow cooker.
Step 2: Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours, or until the potatoes are tender.
Step 3: Stir in the cream cheese until melted and smooth.
Step 4: Ladle the chowder into bowls and top with crumbled bacon and chopped chives.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of creamy potato chowder in a rustic, off-white bowl.  Garnish with crumbled bacon and fresh chives.  Use a shallow depth of field to focus sharply on the creamy texture and potato chunks, blurring the bacon in the foreground.  Employ soft, natural lighting to highlight the warm, inviting colors of the chowder. A dark wood background and a linen napkin draped casually beside the bowl will complete the cozy, comforting scene.

recipes.name: Copycat Cracker Barrel Hashbrown Casserole
ingredients: 1 (10.25 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1/2 cup yellow onion, peeled and chopped
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Step 2: In a large bowl, combine the melted butter, cream of chicken soup, sour cream, chopped onion, shredded cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper.
Step 3: Add the frozen hash browns to the bowl and mix well to combine all ingredients.
Step 4: Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and spread evenly.
Step 5: Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until golden brown and heated through. Let stand for a few minutes before serving.

Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh chives. Soft, diffused natural light from the side highlights the creamy texture and melted cheese.  Include a serving spoon for scale and added visual interest.

recipes.name: Restaurant-Style Sesame Chicken
ingredients: 3 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 tablespoon Shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry
1/8-1/4 cup white vinegar or rice vinegar
directions: Step 1: Marinate the Chicken: In a medium bowl, combine the chicken cubes, light soy sauce, rice wine (or sherry), 3 drops of sesame oil, flour, 2 tablespoons cornstarch, 2 tablespoons water, baking powder, and baking soda. Mix well and marinate for at least 20 minutes.

Step 2: Prepare the Sauce: In a small saucepan, whisk together the 1/2 cup water, chicken broth, vinegar, 1/4 cup cornstarch, sugar, dark soy sauce, 2 tablespoons sesame oil, chili paste, and minced garlic.
Step 3: Cook the Sauce: Bring the sauce to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low and keep warm.

Step 4: Deep-Fry the Chicken: Heat the peanut oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C). Working in batches, add the marinated chicken to the hot oil and fry until golden brown and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the chicken with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Keep the cooked chicken warm in a preheated oven at 130°F (55°C).

Step 5: Finish the Dish: Just before the last batch of chicken is finished frying, bring the sauce back to a boil. Place the fried chicken on a serving platter and pour the hot sauce over it. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.
Step 6: Serve: Serve the sesame chicken hot with steamed rice.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture glistening, crispy sesame chicken in a dynamic, close-up, slightly overhead angle.  Focus sharply on a few hero pieces, showcasing their texture.  Use a shallow depth of field to blur the background of steamed rice and vibrant green scallions.  Employ warm, directional lighting to highlight the golden-brown crust and create appealing shadows.  A dark, textured backdrop will enhance the dish's richness. Garnish sparingly with toasted sesame seeds. The overall mood should be inviting and appetizing.

video_script.title: Restaurant-Style Sesame Chicken
video_script.description: Learn to make delicious, crispy sesame chicken just like your favorite takeout spot!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate of golden-brown sesame chicken glistening with sauce, garnished with toasted sesame seeds, and served with a side of fluffy white rice.
scenes.voice_over: Craving takeout? Skip the delivery and make this amazing sesame chicken at home! It's crispy, flavorful, and better than any restaurant.

scenes.image_prompt: Show chicken breast cubes, soy sauce, Shaoxing rice wine, sesame oil, flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, and water in separate bowls, arranged neatly on a wooden cutting board.  Zoom in slightly as the ingredients are listed.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: chicken breast, light soy sauce, Shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry, sesame oil, flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, and water for the marinade.

scenes.image_prompt: Show a hand mixing the chicken and marinade ingredients in a bowl until evenly coated.  Focus on the texture of the marinade and the chicken absorbing the flavors.
scenes.voice_over: Combine the chicken with the marinade ingredients, ensuring every piece is coated. Let it marinate for at least 20 minutes. This is key for juicy, flavorful chicken.

scenes.image_prompt: Show water, chicken broth, vinegar, cornstarch, sugar, dark soy sauce, sesame oil, chili paste, and minced garlic in small bowls, ready to be combined.  As each ingredient is listed, visually highlight the ingredient.
scenes.voice_over: For the signature sesame sauce, you'll need: water, chicken broth, vinegar, cornstarch, sugar, dark soy sauce, sesame oil, chili paste, and garlic.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the sauce ingredients being whisked together in a saucepan. Then show the sauce thickening as it comes to a boil, transitioning from a thin liquid to a glossy, flavorful sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Whisk together the sauce ingredients in a saucepan. Bring it to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly, then reduce heat to low and keep warm.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the process of deep frying the chicken in hot oil. Include shots of the chicken being carefully added to the oil and turning golden brown and crispy.
scenes.voice_over: Heat peanut oil to 350°F (175°C). Fry the chicken in batches until golden brown and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Keep warm in a preheated oven at 130°F (55°C).

scenes.image_prompt: Show the last batch of chicken being added to the hot oil and the sauce being brought back to a boil on the stove, emphasizing the timing aspect.
scenes.voice_over: Just before the last batch of chicken is done, reheat the sauce. Place the fried chicken on a serving platter, pour the hot sauce over it, and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds.

scenes.image_prompt: Show a final shot of the completed sesame chicken dish, garnished with sesame seeds and served with steamed rice, chopsticks ready to go.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your restaurant-style sesame chicken hot with steamed rice. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy chicken, you can double fry it. Fry the chicken once, remove and drain, then increase the oil temperature slightly and fry again for a shorter time until extra crispy.
Adjust the amount of vinegar and sugar in the sauce to your liking. More vinegar will make it tangier, while more sugar will make it sweeter.
If you don't have a deep fryer, you can use a large pot and a candy thermometer to monitor the oil temperature.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Taco Soup
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) can white beans or kidney beans, undrained

directions: Step 1: Brown and drain the ground beef (or cook and shred the chicken or other chosen meat).
Step 2: Add all ingredients, including the undrained canned goods, to a slow cooker.
Step 3: Stir to combine.
Step 4: Cook on high for 2 hours, or on low for 4 hours.
Step 5: Once cooked, reduce heat to low to keep warm until serving.
Step 6: Garnish with your favorite toppings such as sour cream, shredded cheese, chopped green onions, and/or tortilla chips.

cooking_tips: For a thicker soup, reduce the amount of diced tomatoes or simmer uncovered for the last 30 minutes of cooking.

recipes.name: General Tso's Chicken
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
8 small dried chilies, such as bird's eye or Thai chilies, stems and seeds removed
1/4 cup soy sauce, low sodium preferred
1/2 cup soy sauce, low sodium preferred
1/4 cup dry sherry or white wine
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Sauce: In a jar with a lid, combine the minced garlic, 1/4 cup soy sauce, sugar, 1/2 cup soy sauce, white vinegar, sherry or white wine, and chicken broth. Shake well to combine. Set aside.
Step 2: Prepare the Chicken: In a large bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup cornstarch, the beaten egg, and water until a thick slurry forms.
Step 3: Coat the Chicken: Add the chicken cubes to the cornstarch slurry and toss to coat evenly.

Step 4: Fry the Chicken: Heat about 1 inch of vegetable oil in a large wok or deep skillet to 350°F (175°C). Working in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan, carefully add the chicken pieces to the hot oil, ensuring excess slurry drips off. Fry for 5-7 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy. Remove the chicken with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Keep warm in a preheated oven set to the lowest temperature.

Step 5: Stir-Fry Aromatics: Carefully pour off most of the frying oil, leaving about 1 tablespoon in the wok or skillet. Increase the heat to 400°F (200°C). Add the green onions and dried chilies to the hot oil and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.

Step 6: Combine Sauce and Chicken: Give the sauce mixture a good shake, then pour it into the wok with the green onions and chilies. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens, about 1-2 minutes. If the sauce becomes too thick, add a little water to adjust the consistency.
Step 7: Finish the Dish: Add the fried chicken to the sauce and toss to coat evenly. Cook for another minute, or until heated through and bubbly.
Step 8: Serve: Serve the General Tso's chicken immediately over steamed rice.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture General Tso's chicken glistening with sauce, showcasing its crispy texture.  Use a dark, textured backdrop to contrast the vibrant orange-red sauce and bright green onions. Incorporate a few dried chilies for color and a subtle hint of steam rising from the dish. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to reveal the texture and sauce coating. recipes.name: Crock-Pot Chicken with Creamy Gravy and Herb Stuffing
ingredients: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
2 cups Pepperidge Farm Herb Seasoned Stuffing Mix
directions: Step 1: Season the chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper. Place the seasoned chicken breasts in the bottom of a slow cooker.
Step 2: Pour the chicken broth over the chicken breasts. Place one slice of Swiss cheese on top of each chicken breast.

Step 3: In a medium bowl, whisk together the condensed cream of chicken soup, condensed cream of mushroom soup, and milk until smooth. Pour the soup mixture over the chicken breasts in the slow cooker.
Step 4: Sprinkle the dry herb seasoned stuffing mix evenly over the soup mixture.
Step 5: Drizzle the melted butter over the stuffing mix.
Step 6: Cover and cook on low for 6 hours or on high for 3 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and the stuffing is tender.

recipes.name: Thin Crust Pizza Dough
ingredients: 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour (or substitute up to 1 cup with whole wheat flour)
directions: Step 1: Activate the yeast: In a small bowl, combine the warm water with a pinch of sugar. Sprinkle the yeast over the water and let stand for 10 minutes, or until foamy.
Step 2: Combine dry ingredients: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour and salt.
Step 3: Mix the dough: Add the activated yeast mixture and olive oil to the dry ingredients. Stir until a shaggy dough forms.
Step 4: Knead the dough: Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 6-8 minutes, or until smooth and elastic. Add a little more flour if the dough is too sticky.

Step 5: First rise (bulk fermentation): Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for 20-30 minutes, or until doubled in size.
Step 6: Prepare the pizza pans: Lightly grease two 12-inch pizza pans and dust with cornmeal.

Step 7: Shape the pizzas: Divide the dough in half. Place each half on a prepared pizza pan and pat it out with your fingers, stretching it to the edges of the pan. Create a slightly thicker crust around the edge.
Step 8: Optional pre-bake: If desired, pre-bake the crusts at 425°F (220°C) for 10 minutes.
Step 9: Add toppings: Spread pizza sauce over the crusts and add your desired toppings.
Step 10: Bake: Bake for 10-20 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Step 11: Cool and serve: Let the pizzas cool slightly before slicing and serving.
Step 12: Freezing instructions: To freeze leftover dough, form it into a ball, rub with olive oil, and place in a freezer bag. Thaw completely before using.

recipes.name: Classic Lasagna
ingredients: 2 (14.5 oz) cans Whole Tomatoes, undrained and chopped
24 oz Cottage Cheese or Ricotta Cheese
1 lb Mozzarella Cheese, shredded and divided
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, brown ground beef and Italian sausage over medium-high heat. Drain off excess grease.
3. Add chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Stir in salt, dried parsley flakes, dried oregano, dried basil, chopped tomatoes, and tomato paste. Bring to a simmer and cook for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
5. While the sauce simmers, cook lasagna noodles according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
6. In a medium bowl, combine cottage cheese (or ricotta cheese), beaten eggs, black pepper, chopped fresh parsley, and grated Parmesan cheese. Stir in half of the mozzarella cheese.
7. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Spread a thin layer of meat sauce in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
9. Top with a layer of lasagna noodles, followed by a layer of the cheese mixture. Repeat layers, ending with a layer of noodles.
10. Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella cheese evenly over the top layer of noodles.
11. Bake for 30-40 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the lasagna is heated through.

The background should be slightly blurred, featuring dark wood and linen napkins, creating a cozy, comforting mood.  Shoot from a slightly overhead, angled perspective.

recipes.name: General Tso's Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine ½ cup cornstarch and the beaten eggs. Add the chicken and toss to coat evenly. If the mixture seems too thick, add a small amount of peanut oil to help separate the chicken pieces.
Step 2: In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining 2 teaspoons of cornstarch, rice wine, rice vinegar, sugar, and soy sauce. Set aside.
Step 3: Heat 1-2 inches of peanut oil in a wok or large, deep skillet over medium-high heat (350-400°F).
Step 4: Fry the chicken in small batches until cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per batch. Remove the chicken from the wok and place it on a wire rack or paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
Step 5: Remove all but 1-2 tablespoons of oil from the wok. Add the dried chili pods and stir-fry briefly until fragrant, being careful not to burn them.
Step 6: Return the chicken to the wok. Stir-fry until the chicken is crispy and golden brown, about 2-3 minutes.
Step 7: Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken and stir-fry continuously until the sauce thickens and glazes the chicken, about 1-2 minutes.
Step 8: Serve immediately over steamed rice with steamed broccoli on the side.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture glistening General Tso's chicken, expertly styled in a dark-glazed bowl against a dark, textured backdrop.  Focus sharply on a succulent piece of chicken coated in the rich, glossy sauce, with a shallow depth of field blurring the surrounding pieces.  Use warm, directional lighting to highlight the sauce's texture and the vibrant red chilies scattered throughout. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and chopped scallions. video_script.title: General Tso's Chicken
video_script.description: Learn to make this takeout classic at home! Crispy chicken coated in a sweet and savory sauce, it's easier than you think.

scenes.voice_over: Cut the chicken thighs into one-inch cubes. In a bowl, combine the cornstarch, eggs, and chicken, mixing until the chicken is evenly coated.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of whisking together cornstarch, rice wine, rice vinegar, sugar, and soy sauce in a small bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a separate bowl, whisk together the remaining cornstarch, rice wine, rice vinegar, sugar and soy sauce. Set this aside for later.

scenes.image_prompt: Peanut oil heating in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
scenes.voice_over: Heat one to two inches of peanut oil in a wok or large, deep skillet to 350-400°F.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken pieces frying in hot oil, turning golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Carefully add the chicken to the hot oil in small batches, frying for 3-4 minutes per batch until golden brown and cooked through.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of chili pods being stir-fried in the wok.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the chicken and drain the excess oil. Add the dried chili pods to the wok and stir-fry briefly until fragrant. Be careful not to burn them.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken being returned to the wok and stir-fried with the chili pods.
scenes.voice_over: Return the chicken to the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until crispy.

scenes.voice_over: Pour the sauce over the chicken and stir-fry continuously for 1-2 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken beautifully.

recipes.name: Greek-Style Turkey Burgers
ingredients: 1/2 cup chopped Kalamata olives (or other salad olives)
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the ground turkey, feta cheese, chopped olives, oregano, Italian seasoning, parsley, basil (if using), onion powder, garlic powder, and black pepper.
Step 2: Gently mix all ingredients until just combined. Do not overmix.
Step 3: Form the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties.
Step 4: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Step 5: Grill the patties for 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Step 6: Serve on regular burger buns with desired toppings such as tomatoes and mayonnaise, or on pita bread with tahini, tomatoes, and lettuce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture four juicy Greek-style turkey burgers on a rustic wooden board, garnished with fresh oregano sprigs and crumbled feta.  Background: slightly blurred whitewashed brick. Lighting: bright, natural, highlighting the golden-brown crust and vibrant olive pieces within the patties.  Shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on the front burger, with a 45-degree angle showcasing the burger's thickness and texture. Mood: inviting, summery, and fresh. Include a small bowl of tzatziki sauce in the background, slightly out of focus.

video_script.title: Greek-Style Turkey Burgers
video_script.description: Learn how to make juicy and flavorful Greek-style turkey burgers with feta, olives, and Mediterranean herbs.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of two juicy Greek-style turkey burgers on toasted buns, topped with fresh tomatoes, lettuce, and a dollop of creamy tahini sauce. The background features a rustic wooden table setting with a few Kalamata olives scattered around.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making delicious Greek-style turkey burgers packed with flavor from feta, olives, and Mediterranean herbs. These burgers are a healthy and satisfying alternative to traditional beef burgers.

scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, combine the ground turkey, crumbled feta, chopped olives, and all the dried herbs and spices. Gently mix until everything is just combined. Be careful not to overmix.

scenes.image_prompt: Show hands shaping the turkey mixture into four equally sized patties.
scenes.voice_over: Divide the mixture into four equal portions and shape them into patties about 3/4 inch thick.

scenes.image_prompt: A grill preheating to medium-high heat with flames visible.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Turkey burgers cooking on the grill. Show grill marks on the patties.
scenes.voice_over: Place the patties on the hot grill and cook for 5-7 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a cooked turkey burger being checked with a meat thermometer, showing 165°F.
scenes.voice_over: Make sure to check the internal temperature with a meat thermometer to ensure they’re cooked through.

scenes.image_prompt: Two fully cooked turkey burgers are shown, one served on a bun with tomato and mayonnaise and the other on pita bread with tahini sauce, tomatoes, and lettuce
scenes.voice_over: Serve your Greek turkey burgers on regular buns with your favorite toppings or on pita bread with tahini, tomatoes, and lettuce for an authentic Greek experience. You can also add other Mediterranean-inspired toppings such as cucumbers, onions, or a sprinkle of fresh dill.

recipes.name: Crispy Ginger Beef Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 lb flank steak or sirloin steak, thinly sliced into strips
3 teaspoons crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water until smooth. Beat in the eggs.
Step 2: Add the beef strips to the cornstarch mixture and stir to coat evenly.
Step 3: Heat about 1 inch of canola oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering hot (around 375°F).

Step 4: Working in batches, add about a quarter of the beef to the hot oil. Separate the strips with a fork and cook, stirring occasionally, until crispy and golden brown (about 2-3 minutes). Remove the beef with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Repeat with the remaining beef.
Step 5: Remove all but 1 tablespoon of oil from the wok. Add the carrots, green onions, ginger, and garlic to the wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until slightly softened.
Step 6: In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, and red pepper flakes.
Step 7: Pour the sauce over the vegetables and bring to a boil. Return the cooked beef to the wok and toss to coat with the sauce. Heat through.
Step 8: Serve the crispy ginger beef immediately over rice or noodles.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a crispy ginger beef stir-fry with julienned carrots and sliced green onions, glistening with sauce. Style the stir-fry in a shallow, dark-colored bowl against a rustic wooden backdrop. Use a slightly overhead, angled shot with a shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on the beef.  Emphasize the texture of the crispy beef and vibrant colors with soft, directional lighting creating highlights. Garnish with fresh ginger slivers and chopped green onions. Aim for a warm, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Crispy Ginger Beef Stir-Fry
video_script.description: Learn how to make a delicious and easy Crispy Ginger Beef Stir-Fry with this step-by-step video tutorial.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished Crispy Ginger Beef Stir-Fry, glistening with sauce and served over steamed rice. Focus on the crispy texture of the beef and vibrant colors of the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Ready for a flavor explosion? Today, we're making Crispy Ginger Beef Stir-Fry.  It's crispy, savory, and incredibly easy to make.

scenes.image_prompt: Show all ingredients neatly arranged: flank steak strips, cornstarch, water, eggs in a bowl, julienned carrots, sliced green onions, minced ginger and garlic, soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, red pepper flakes, canola oil.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: flank steak or sirloin, cornstarch, water, eggs, carrots, green onions, fresh ginger, garlic, canola oil for frying, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, and red pepper flakes for that extra kick.

scenes.image_prompt: Show a bowl with cornstarch, water and eggs being whisked together until smooth.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water until smooth. Then, beat in the eggs. This batter will give our beef that amazing crispy coating.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the beef strips being added to the cornstarch mixture and stirred to coat evenly.
scenes.voice_over: Add the beef strips to the batter and make sure each piece is thoroughly coated.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the beef strips frying in hot oil, turning golden brown and crispy.
scenes.voice_over: Heat about an inch of canola oil in a wok or large skillet to 375°F. Fry the beef in batches for 2-3 minutes until golden brown and crispy. Don't overcrowd the pan! Drain on paper towels.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the carrots, green onions, ginger and garlic being stir-fried in the wok.
scenes.voice_over: Remove most of the oil, leaving about a tablespoon. Add the carrots, green onions, ginger, and garlic to the wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until slightly softened.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the sauce ingredients being whisked together in a small bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, and red pepper flakes.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the sauce being poured over the vegetables, the beef being returned to the wok, and everything being tossed together.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the sauce over the vegetables, bring to a boil, then return the crispy beef to the wok. Toss everything together to coat in the sauce and heat through.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the finished dish, served with rice and garnished with chopped green onions. A pair of chopsticks are picking up a piece of beef.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your crispy ginger beef hot over rice or noodles. Garnish with extra green onions if desired. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy beef, you can double fry it. After the first fry, increase the oil temperature slightly and fry the beef again for a minute until extra crispy.
If you don't have a wok, a large skillet will work just fine.
Adjust the amount of red pepper flakes to control the spiciness level.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Creamy Italian Chicken
ingredients: 1 (2/3 ounce) package Italian salad dressing mix
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1: Place chicken pieces in the slow cooker.
Step 2: Sprinkle the Italian salad dressing mix evenly over the chicken.
Step 3: Drizzle 2 tablespoons of melted butter over the chicken.
Step 4: Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Step 5: In a medium saucepan, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat.
Step 6: Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the saucepan and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Step 7: Add the cream of chicken soup, softened cream cheese, and chicken broth to the saucepan.
Step 8: Stir until the mixture is smooth and heated through.
Step 9: Pour the sauce over the chicken in the slow cooker.
Step 10: Continue cooking on low for an additional 30 minutes, or until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of Slow Cooker Creamy Italian Chicken in a rustic, white bowl.  The chicken, coated in a rich, creamy sauce, should be the focal point, with a shallow depth of field blurring the background.  Use natural, soft lighting to highlight the textures of the chicken and the glistening sauce. Garnish with fresh parsley and a sprinkle of black pepper.  Include a wooden serving spoon and a linen napkin in the background for a warm, inviting mood.  Compose the shot to emphasize the creamy texture and savory appeal of the dish.

video_script.title: Slow Cooker Creamy Italian Chicken
video_script.description: Learn how to make this easy and delicious slow cooker creamy Italian chicken recipe. Perfect for a weeknight meal!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished slow cooker creamy Italian chicken dish, garnished with fresh parsley, served with a side of pasta. Steam is gently rising from the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome to our channel! Today, we're making a comforting and flavorful slow cooker creamy Italian chicken. It's easy, requires minimal prep, and cooks to tender perfection in your slow cooker.

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: Chicken pieces, Italian dressing mix, butter, onion, garlic, cream of chicken soup, cream cheese, and chicken broth.  We'll also add some salt and pepper for seasoning at the end.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken pieces being placed in the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: Place the chicken pieces in your slow cooker.

scenes.image_prompt: Sprinkling the Italian dressing mix over the chicken in the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: Sprinkle the Italian dressing mix evenly over the chicken. This will give it a ton of flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Melting butter and drizzling it over the chicken in the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: Drizzle two tablespoons of melted butter over the seasoned chicken. This adds richness and helps keep the chicken moist.

scenes.image_prompt: Slow cooker lid being placed on top.
scenes.voice_over: Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 4-6 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through.

scenes.image_prompt: Sautéing chopped onions and minced garlic in a saucepan with melted butter.
scenes.voice_over: While the chicken is cooking, let's make the creamy sauce. Sauté chopped onion and minced garlic in the remaining melted butter until softened, about 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Adding cream of chicken soup, softened cream cheese, and chicken broth to the saucepan with the sautéed onions and garlic.
scenes.voice_over: Add the cream of chicken soup, softened cream cheese, and chicken broth to the saucepan. Stir until smooth and heated through.

scenes.image_prompt: Pouring the creamy sauce over the cooked chicken in the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the sauce over the chicken in the slow cooker.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the finished slow cooker creamy Italian chicken, garnished with fresh parsley, being served over a bed of pasta.
scenes.voice_over: Continue cooking on low for another 30 minutes to let the flavors meld. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve this creamy Italian chicken over pasta, rice, or mashed potatoes. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Creamy Sour Cream Chicken Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, diced
1 1/2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.

Step 2: In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the diced chicken and chopped onion and cook until the chicken is cooked through and the onion is softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 3: Divide the cooked chicken evenly among the tortillas. Sprinkle 1 1/2 tablespoons of cheese over the chicken in each tortilla.
Step 4: Roll up the tortillas tightly and place them seam-down in the prepared baking dish.
Step 5: In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1-2 minutes, until bubbly.
Step 6: Gradually whisk in the chicken broth until smooth. Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring constantly.
Step 7: Reduce heat to low and stir in the sour cream and green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until heated through.
Step 8: Pour the sauce evenly over the enchiladas in the baking dish. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top.
Step 9: Bake for 20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the sauce is heated through.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture creamy Sour Cream Chicken Enchiladas, sliced to reveal the cheesy, saucy interior, in a warm, inviting setting. Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the cheesy filling.  Natural, slightly diffused lighting should highlight the creamy texture of the sauce and golden tortilla edges.  Garnish with chopped cilantro and a sprinkle of Monterey Jack cheese. Rustic wooden background with linen napkins and scattered green chilies adds visual interest.  Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing three enchiladas arranged artfully on a white oval platter.

video_script.title: Creamy Sour Cream Chicken Enchiladas
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious and creamy sour cream chicken enchiladas with this easy-to-follow recipe!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished creamy sour cream chicken enchilada casserole, bubbly cheese on top, garnished with fresh cilantro, in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
scenes.voice_over: Get ready to make incredibly creamy and cheesy chicken enchiladas! This recipe is easy to follow and perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients laid out on a wooden table: diced chicken breasts, chopped onion, vegetable oil, can of green chilies, sour cream, chicken broth, flour, and butter.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: diced chicken breasts, onion, vegetable oil, flour tortillas, Monterey Jack cheese, butter, flour, chicken broth, sour cream, and canned green chilies.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a skillet with diced chicken and chopped onions cooking in oil. Steam rising, chicken browning, and onions softening.
scenes.voice_over: Start by cooking the chicken and onion in vegetable oil over medium-high heat until cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. This builds a flavorful base for our enchiladas.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hands filling and rolling a flour tortilla with chicken and cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Fill each tortilla with the cooked chicken mixture and a sprinkle of cheese. Roll them up tightly and place them seam-down in a greased 9x13 baking dish.

scenes.image_prompt: A saucepan on the stove with melted butter and flour, forming a roux.
scenes.voice_over: Melt butter in a saucepan, whisk in flour, cook for 1-2 minutes. Gradually whisk in the chicken broth until the mixture boils and thickens. This creates a rich and creamy sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: The sauce in the saucepan with sour cream and green chilies being stirred in.
scenes.voice_over: Reduce heat and stir in sour cream and green chilies. Let it simmer for 2-3 minutes until heated through. This adds a tangy and slightly spicy kick to the sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Pouring the creamy sauce over the rolled enchiladas in the baking dish.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the sauce evenly over the enchiladas and sprinkle with the remaining cheese. This ensures every bite is full of flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: The baking dish with the enchiladas, covered in bubbly cheese, coming out of the oven. Steam rising, golden brown cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted, bubbly, and golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a serving of creamy sour cream chicken enchiladas on a plate, garnished with fresh cilantro, with sides of Spanish rice and refried beans.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your creamy sour cream chicken enchiladas hot, with your favorite sides.  I recommend Spanish rice and refried beans! These enchiladas have about 400 calories, 30 grams of protein, 35 grams of carbs, and 20 grams of fat per serving.

cooking_tips: For a spicier dish, use a can of diced green chilies with jalapeños.
You can substitute corn tortillas for flour tortillas for a gluten-free option.
If you want to make ahead, assemble the enchiladas and cover them tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for up to 24 hours before baking.

recipes.name: Greek Lemon Chicken and Potatoes
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 3/4-inch cubes
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Step 2: In a 9x13 inch glass baking pan, combine the chicken, potatoes, and garlic.
Step 3: Season with salt and pepper.
Step 4: Dissolve the bouillon cube in the water and pour over the chicken and potato mixture.
Step 5: In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, and oregano.
Step 6: Pour the lemon-herb mixture over the chicken and potatoes.
Step 7: Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are tender and golden brown, basting occasionally with pan juices.
