recipes.name: Easy Spanish Rice
directions: Step 1: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Step 2: Add the rice and chopped onion to the skillet and cook for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the rice is golden brown and the onion is tender.
Step 3: Stir in the water, tomato sauce, chopped green bell pepper, salt, chili powder, and garlic powder.
Step 4: Bring the mixture to a boil.
Step 5: Reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed, stirring occasionally.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant close-up of Easy Spanish Rice, showcasing its texture and rich color.  Use a slightly overhead angle, shallow depth of field focusing on a spoonful lifted from the pan.  Natural, directional light should highlight the glistening grains and chopped vegetables.  A dark, rustic background with a worn wooden spoon and a sprinkle of fresh cilantro as garnish will create a warm, inviting mood. The pan should be a cast iron skillet, slightly worn.

video_script.title: Easy Spanish Rice
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious Spanish Rice with this simple recipe!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate of fluffy, vibrant Spanish rice garnished with fresh parsley. Steam gently rises from the rice.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a quick and easy Spanish rice that's bursting with flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: uncooked rice, chopped onion, olive oil, canned tomato sauce, chopped bell pepper, salt, chili powder, and garlic powder.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: one cup of uncooked long-grain white rice, one medium chopped yellow onion, two tablespoons of olive oil, two and a half cups of water, an eight-ounce can of tomato sauce, one small chopped green bell pepper, one and a half teaspoons of salt, three-quarters of a teaspoon of chili powder, and one-eighth of a teaspoon of garlic powder.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of olive oil being heated in a large skillet over medium heat.
scenes.voice_over: Heat two tablespoons of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of rice and chopped onion being added to the skillet, stirring occasionally until golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Add the rice and chopped onion to the skillet. Cook for 5-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the rice is lightly golden and the onion is tender.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of adding water, tomato sauce, chopped bell pepper, salt, chili powder, and garlic powder to the skillet and stirring to combine.
scenes.voice_over: Stir in the water, tomato sauce, chopped bell pepper, salt, chili powder, and garlic powder.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the mixture coming to a boil in the skillet.
scenes.voice_over: Bring the mixture to a boil.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the skillet covered and simmering over low heat.
scenes.voice_over: Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Stir occasionally.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished Spanish rice, fluffy and cooked to perfection, being fluffed with a fork.
scenes.voice_over: Once the rice is cooked, fluff it with a fork.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of a serving of Spanish rice on a plate, garnished with fresh parsley, alongside suggested serving options: grilled chicken or fish, black beans, and a side salad.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious Spanish rice hot as a side dish. It pairs perfectly with grilled chicken or fish, black beans, and a fresh salad. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use chicken or vegetable broth instead of water.
Add a pinch of cumin or oregano for extra depth of flavor.
If the rice is not tender after 25 minutes, add a little more water and continue simmering until cooked through.
Garnish with chopped cilantro or parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Crock-Pot Creamy Chicken with Black Beans and Corn
ingredients: 1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
directions: Step 1: Place frozen chicken breasts in the bottom of a slow cooker.
Step 2: Add drained and rinsed black beans, drained corn, and salsa to the slow cooker.
Step 3: Cover and cook on high for 4-5 hours, or until chicken is cooked through.
Step 4: Add softened cream cheese to the slow cooker and stir until melted and combined.
Step 5: Cover and cook for an additional 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Serve hot.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture Crock-Pot Creamy Chicken with Black Beans and Corn in a rustic, inviting setting.  Use a shallow bowl, garnished with fresh cilantro and a dollop of sour cream.  Employ soft, natural light from the side to highlight the creamy texture and vibrant colors. Focus on the chicken and foreground elements, with a shallow depth of field blurring the background.  Incorporate warm, earthy tones in the props and backdrop, like a wooden serving board and linen napkin, to evoke a cozy, comforting mood. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle to showcase the dish's texture and ingredients.

video_script.title: Crock-Pot Creamy Chicken with Black Beans and Corn
video_script.description: A quick and easy recipe for a flavorful and creamy chicken dish made in a slow cooker.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished Crock-Pot Creamy Chicken with Black Beans and Corn, garnished with fresh cilantro and a dollop of sour cream, in a white bowl against a rustic wooden background. The chicken should look tender and juicy, coated in a creamy sauce, mixed with black beans and corn. Steam should be gently rising from the dish.
scenes.text: Crock-Pot Creamy Chicken with Black Beans and Corn
scenes.voice_over: Craving a comforting and flavorful meal that's ready when you are?  Then look no further! This Crock-Pot Creamy Chicken with Black Beans and Corn is the perfect weeknight dinner solution. It’s simple to make, packed with protein, and bursting with delicious flavors.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden cutting board.  Frozen chicken breasts, can of black beans, can of corn, jar of salsa, and package of cream cheese should all be visible and clearly labeled.
scenes.voice_over: Here’s what you’ll need: four to five frozen boneless, skinless chicken breasts, one can of black beans, one can of corn, one jar of your favorite salsa, and one package of softened cream cheese.  Feel free to adjust the salsa to your preference – mild, medium, or hot!

scenes.image_prompt: Frozen chicken breasts being placed in the bottom of a slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: Start by placing the frozen chicken breasts in the bottom of your slow cooker.

scenes.image_prompt: Drained black beans, corn, and salsa being added to the slow cooker on top of the chicken breasts.
scenes.voice_over: Next, add the drained and rinsed black beans, drained corn, and your chosen salsa.  No need to thaw anything - the slow cooker does all the work!

scenes.image_prompt: The slow cooker's lid being placed on top.
scenes.voice_over: Cover and cook on high for four to five hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and easily shreds with a fork.

scenes.image_prompt: Softened cream cheese being added to the slow cooker with the cooked chicken, beans, corn, and salsa. The mixture is being stirred.
scenes.voice_over: Once the chicken is cooked, add the softened cream cheese. Stir everything together until the cream cheese is melted and fully combined. This creates a rich and creamy sauce that coats the chicken and vegetables beautifully.

scenes.image_prompt: The slow cooker's lid being placed back on top.
scenes.voice_over: Cover and cook for another 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. This extra step really enhances the taste!

scenes.image_prompt: Two bowls filled with Crock-Pot Creamy Chicken with Black Beans and Corn, garnished with fresh cilantro, a dollop of sour cream, and served with a side of white rice and a basket of tortilla chips.
scenes.voice_over: Serve this Crock-Pot Creamy Chicken with Black Beans and Corn hot. It’s fantastic on its own, or you can serve it over rice, with tortillas, or your favorite sides.  It's about 400 calories per serving with 30 grams of protein, 35 grams of carbs, and 20 grams of fat.  Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a spicier dish, use a hotter variety of salsa.
Shred the chicken with two forks before serving.
Serve with rice, sour cream, and chopped cilantro for a complete meal.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Lasagna
ingredients: 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese or 1/2 cup grated Asiago cheese
directions: Step 1: In a large skillet, brown the ground beef over medium-high heat. Drain off any excess grease.
Step 2: Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Stir in the tomato sauce, tomato paste, salt, and oregano. Cook for another 5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Step 4: Spread a thin layer of the meat sauce in the bottom of the slow cooker.
Step 5: Break lasagna noodles to fit and create a double layer over the meat sauce.
Step 6: Top the noodles with a layer of cottage cheese, followed by a sprinkle of Parmesan or Asiago cheese, and finally a layer of mozzarella cheese.
Step 7: Repeat layers of meat sauce, noodles, and cheeses until all ingredients are used up. Finish with a layer of mozzarella cheese.
Step 8: Cover and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours, or until the noodles are tender.
Step 9: Let stand for 10-15 minutes before serving.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a slow cooker lasagna overflowing with cheesy goodness, shot from a slightly overhead angle. Focus on the melted cheese and bubbling sauce, using a shallow depth of field to highlight the textures. Utilize dark, rustic wooden background and linen napkins for a cozy, inviting mood. Garnish with fresh basil sprigs and a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese. Incorporate soft, diffused natural light to enhance the warm tones and create a mouthwatering image suitable for a food magazine cover.

video_script.title: Slow Cooker Lasagna: Comfort Food Made Easy
video_script.description: A simple and delicious recipe for lasagna made in your slow cooker. Perfect for busy weeknights!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished slow cooker lasagna, bubbly, cheesy, and garnished with fresh basil. Steam gently rises from the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Craving lasagna but short on time? This slow cooker lasagna recipe is your answer! It's hearty, cheesy, and effortlessly delicious.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients arranged neatly on a countertop: ground beef, onion, garlic, canned tomato sauce, and tomato paste.
scenes.voice_over: Let's gather our ingredients. We'll start with one pound of lean ground beef, a medium onion, two cloves of garlic, a 28-ounce can of tomato sauce, and a 6-ounce can of tomato paste.

scenes.image_prompt: The remaining ingredients displayed: cottage cheese, Parmesan, lasagna noodles, and shredded mozzarella cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Next, we'll need 12 ounces of cottage cheese – I recommend 2% – half a cup of grated Parmesan, 12 ounces of uncooked lasagna noodles, and 16 ounces of shredded mozzarella cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: Ground beef browning in a skillet on a stovetop.
scenes.voice_over: In a large skillet, brown the ground beef over medium-high heat. Drain any excess grease.

scenes.image_prompt: Onions and garlic being sautéed in the skillet with the browned ground beef.
scenes.voice_over: Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.  This builds a flavorful base for our sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Tomato sauce, tomato paste, salt, and oregano being added to the skillet with the beef, onions, and garlic.
scenes.voice_over: Stir in the tomato sauce, tomato paste, 1 and a half teaspoons of salt, and 1 teaspoon of dried oregano. Let it simmer for 5 minutes to let the flavors meld.

scenes.image_prompt: Layering the lasagna ingredients in a slow cooker: meat sauce, broken lasagna noodles, cottage cheese, Parmesan, and mozzarella cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Now, spread a thin layer of meat sauce in the bottom of your slow cooker. Break the lasagna noodles to fit and create a double layer over the sauce. Top with cottage cheese, Parmesan, and mozzarella.

scenes.image_prompt: Repeating the layers of meat sauce, noodles, and cheeses in the slow cooker, finishing with a layer of mozzarella.
scenes.voice_over: Repeat these layers until all ingredients are used up. Make sure to finish with a generous layer of mozzarella cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: Slow cooker with the lid on, cooking the lasagna.
scenes.voice_over: Cover and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours, or until the noodles are tender.

scenes.image_prompt: A slice of slow cooker lasagna being served onto a plate, garnished with fresh basil.
scenes.voice_over: Let the lasagna stand for 10-15 minutes before serving. This makes it easier to slice and serve. Enjoy! This recipe makes about 6-8 servings, each with approximately 400-500 calories, 25-30 grams of protein, 40-50 grams of carbs and 20-25 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use Italian sausage instead of ground beef.
If your slow cooker runs hot, reduce the cooking time to 3-4 hours on low, or 1.5-2 hours on high.
You can add a layer of ricotta cheese along with the cottage cheese for extra creaminess.
Freshly grated mozzarella cheese melts better and has a superior flavor.
Serve with a side salad and garlic bread for a complete meal.

recipes.name: Slow-Cooker Braised Beef Short Ribs
directions: Step 1: In a large resealable bag, combine the flour, salt, and pepper. Add the beef short ribs and shake to coat evenly.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture slow-cooker braised beef short ribs, fall-apart tender, glistening with rich sauce. Deep, warm lighting highlights the meat's texture and the sauce's deep mahogany color.  Shallow depth of field focuses on a fork-tender rib, pulling away from the bone. Rustic wooden background, linen napkin, and scattered sprigs of fresh thyme create a warm, inviting mood. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the succulent ribs nestled amongst caramelized onions in a Dutch oven.

video_script.title: Slow Cooker Braised Beef Short Ribs
video_script.description: Tender, fall-apart beef short ribs braised in a rich and flavorful sauce, perfect for a cozy meal.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate of perfectly braised beef short ribs, glistening with rich sauce, garnished with fresh parsley.  Focus on the texture and deep color of the ribs.
scenes.text: Slow Cooker Braised Beef Short Ribs
scenes.voice_over: Indulge in the ultimate comfort food: slow cooker braised beef short ribs. Tender, flavorful, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: flour, salt, pepper, beef short ribs, butter, onion, beef broth, red wine vinegar, brown sugar, chili sauce, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, chili powder.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need for this mouthwatering recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of short ribs being seasoned with flour, salt, and pepper in a large ziplock bag.
scenes.voice_over: In a large resealable bag, combine one-third cup all-purpose flour, one teaspoon salt, and a quarter teaspoon black pepper. Add the two and a half pounds of boneless beef short ribs, seal the bag, and shake until evenly coated.

scenes.image_prompt: A slow cooker with browned short ribs, onions, and the braising liquid ingredients being added.
scenes.voice_over: Sear the short ribs in a quarter cup of butter until browned.  Then, add the ribs to your slow cooker along with one cup chopped yellow onion. In a bowl, whisk together one cup beef broth, three-quarters cup red wine vinegar, three-quarters cup packed brown sugar, a quarter cup chili sauce, two tablespoons ketchup, two tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, two tablespoons minced garlic, and one teaspoon chili powder. Pour the mixture over the short ribs.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a slow cooker lid being placed on top.  Steam is slightly visible.
scenes.voice_over: Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or until the beef is fork-tender.

scenes.image_prompt: A shot of the braised beef short ribs being pulled apart with two forks, showing how tender they are after slow cooking.
scenes.voice_over: After hours of slow cooking, the short ribs will be incredibly tender and easy to shred.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate of finished braised short ribs served over mashed potatoes, garnished with fresh parsley. Steam rising from the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious braised short ribs over mashed potatoes, polenta, or rice. Garnish with fresh parsley, and enjoy! Each serving contains approximately 500 calories, 35 grams of protein, 30 grams of carbohydrates, and 25 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: For a thicker sauce, remove the ribs after cooking and whisk together 2 tablespoons of cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of cold water.  Stir this mixture into the sauce in the slow cooker and cook on high for an additional 30 minutes, or until thickened.
Serve these short ribs over mashed potatoes, polenta, or egg noodles.
If you prefer a sweeter sauce, add an additional 1/4 cup of brown sugar.

recipes.name: Amazing Grilled or Broiled Chicken Marinade
directions: Step 1: In a large, non-reactive container, whisk together the cider vinegar, whole grain mustard, minced garlic, lime juice, lemon juice, brown sugar, and salt.
Step 2: Whisk in the olive oil and black pepper.
Step 3: Place the chicken breasts in the marinade, ensuring they are fully coated.
Step 4: Cover the container and marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for at least 8 hours, or preferably overnight.
Step 5: Remove the chicken from the marinade about 30 minutes before grilling or broiling to allow it to come to room temperature. Discard the used marinade.
Step 6: Lightly oil your grill grates or broiler pan.
Step 7: Grill or broil the chicken for approximately 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
recipes.image_prompt: Capture grilled chicken breasts glistening with marinade, showcasing grill marks.  Use a dark, rustic wooden background with a shallow depth of field focusing on the chicken's texture. Garnish with lime wedges and scattered fresh herbs. Employ soft, directional lighting to highlight the golden-brown color and char, creating a warm, inviting mood.  Compose the chicken slightly off-center, allowing space for negative space and highlighting the juicy texture. Include a small bowl of the marinade in the background, slightly blurred.

video_script.title: Amazing Grilled or Broiled Chicken Marinade
video_script.description: Learn how to make juicy and flavorful grilled or broiled chicken with this easy marinade recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of several perfectly grilled chicken breasts, glistening with marinade, served with a fresh salad.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a fantastic grilled or broiled chicken with an incredible marinade that's both simple and delicious.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: cider vinegar, whole grain mustard, garlic cloves, lime, lemon, brown sugar, salt, olive oil, black pepper, and chicken breasts.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: cider vinegar, whole grain mustard, garlic, lime, lemon, brown sugar, salt, olive oil, pepper, and of course, boneless, skinless chicken breasts.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a whisk combining cider vinegar, mustard, minced garlic, lime juice, lemon juice, brown sugar, and salt in a glass bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a large non-reactive container, whisk together the cider vinegar, whole grain mustard, minced garlic, lime juice, lemon juice, brown sugar, and salt.

scenes.image_prompt: Whisking olive oil and black pepper into the marinade mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Next, whisk in the olive oil and black pepper until everything is well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken breasts being placed in the marinade, ensuring they are fully submerged and coated.
scenes.voice_over: Place the chicken breasts in the marinade, making sure they are fully coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 8 hours, or preferably overnight.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken breasts being removed from the marinade and placed on a plate.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the chicken from the marinade about 30 minutes before grilling or broiling. Discard the used marinade.

scenes.image_prompt: Grilling chicken breasts on a hot grill with visible grill marks, smoke, and flames.
scenes.voice_over: Lightly oil your grill grates. Grill the chicken for 5-7 minutes per side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a meat thermometer inserted into a grilled chicken breast, reading 165°F.
scenes.voice_over: Use a meat thermometer to ensure the chicken is cooked through.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the finished grilled chicken served on a plate with suggested sides like a fresh salad and roasted vegetables.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious grilled chicken with your favorite sides, like a fresh salad or roasted vegetables. Each serving has approximately 250 calories, 30g of protein, 15g of carbs, and 10g of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra flavor, add a pinch of red pepper flakes to the marinade.
If grilling, preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
Use a meat thermometer to ensure the chicken is cooked to a safe internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).

recipes.name: Perfectly Roasted Pork Tenderloin
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
1 tablespoon dry seasoning blend (such as thyme, savory, rosemary, garlic powder, onion powder, Italian seasoning, or a custom mixture)
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 500-550°F (260-290°C). Ensure your oven is accurate and retains heat well. This method relies on residual heat.
2. Pat the pork tenderloin dry with paper towels. Rub the tenderloin with olive oil (if using), then season generously with salt, pepper, and your chosen dry seasoning blend.
3. Place the seasoned tenderloin in an uncovered roasting pan on a rack positioned in the bottom third of your oven.
4. Roast for EXACTLY 5.5 minutes per pound. Adjust cooking time slightly based on your oven's accuracy and heat retention. For a 1-pound tenderloin, this would be 5.5 minutes.
5. Turn the oven OFF and DO NOT open the oven door for 1 hour.
6. After 1 hour, remove the roasting pan from the oven and let the pork rest for 5-10 minutes to allow the juices to redistribute. This will result in a more tender and flavorful roast.
7. The pork tenderloin should be cooked through, with a very slightly pink center, and very moist. The internal temperature should reach 145-150°F (63-66°C) after resting.

8. If using an oven probe thermometer, insert it into the thickest part of the tenderloin before placing it in the oven. Set the alarm for 140-145°F (60-63°C). The alarm should go off before the hour is up.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a perfectly roasted pork tenderloin, glistening with juices, on a rustic wooden cutting board.  Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the sliced portion revealing the tender pink interior. Soft, diffused natural light from the side highlights the texture and golden-brown crust. Garnish with fresh rosemary sprigs and scattered peppercorns.  The background should be dark and moody, with subtle textures to add depth. Compose the shot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase the succulent slices and create visual interest.  Aim for a rich, warm, and inviting mood.

video_script.title: Perfectly Roasted Pork Tenderloin
video_script.description: Learn how to make the most tender and juicy pork tenderloin with this simple high-heat roasting method.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a perfectly roasted pork tenderloin, sliced to reveal a juicy, slightly pink interior. The tenderloin is resting on a cutting board, garnished with fresh herbs.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making perfectly roasted pork tenderloin - juicy, tender, and foolproof.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients laid out on a table: pork tenderloin, salt, pepper, dry seasoning blend, and olive oil.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: a one-pound pork tenderloin, salt, pepper, a tablespoon of your favorite dry seasoning blend, and a tablespoon of olive oil - optional, for searing.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork tenderloin being patted dry with paper towels.
scenes.voice_over: First, pat the pork tenderloin dry with paper towels. This helps create a nice sear.

scenes.image_prompt: Hands rubbing the pork tenderloin with olive oil and seasoning.
scenes.voice_over: Rub the tenderloin with olive oil, if using, and season generously with salt, pepper, and your dry seasoning blend.

scenes.image_prompt: Seasoned pork tenderloin placed on a rack in a roasting pan.
scenes.voice_over: Place the seasoned tenderloin on a rack in a roasting pan. Preheat your oven to a high heat - between 500 and 550 degrees Fahrenheit.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork tenderloin in the oven, roasting at high heat.
scenes.voice_over: Roast the tenderloin for exactly 5.5 minutes per pound. For a one-pound tenderloin, that's 5.5 minutes.  This high heat sears the outside, locking in the juices.

scenes.image_prompt: The oven door with a sign that reads "DO NOT OPEN".
scenes.voice_over: Now, turn the oven OFF and DO NOT open the door for one hour. The residual heat will gently cook the pork to perfection.

scenes.image_prompt: A meat thermometer inserted into the pork tenderloin, reading 145-150°F.
scenes.voice_over: After an hour, the internal temperature should reach 145 to 150 degrees Fahrenheit. If you're using a probe thermometer, set the alarm for 140-145°F. It should go off before the hour is up.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork tenderloin resting on a cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the pork from the oven and let it rest for 5-10 minutes. This allows the juices to redistribute, resulting in a more tender and flavorful roast.

scenes.image_prompt: Sliced pork tenderloin on a serving platter, garnished with fresh herbs, served with suggested sides.
scenes.voice_over: Slice and serve your perfectly roasted pork tenderloin! It's delicious with roasted vegetables, mashed potatoes, or a fresh salad.  Each serving has approximately 200 calories, 30 grams of protein, 2 grams of carbs, and 7 grams of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: Use a meat thermometer to ensure the pork reaches a safe internal temperature of 145°F (63°C).
Do not open the oven door during the resting period, as this will release heat and affect the final cooking temperature.
For a richer flavor, sear the pork tenderloin in a hot skillet before roasting.

recipes.name: Easy Bread Machine Pizza Dough
directions: Step 1: Add all ingredients to the bread machine in the order listed.
Step 2: Select the dough cycle and press start.
Step 3: Once the cycle is complete, remove the dough from the machine and place it in a well-greased bowl. Roll the dough around to coat it in oil.
Step 4: Cover the bowl and let the dough rise in a warm place for about 30 minutes.
Step 5: Lightly knead the risen dough.
Step 6: Roll out the dough into a circle on a well-greased baking tray or pizza pan.
Step 7: Preheat oven to 225°C (437°F).
Step 8: For a crispier crust, pre-bake the dough for a few minutes before adding toppings.

Step 9: Add desired toppings and bake until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 12-15 minutes. For an extra crispy crust, you can bake the crust again briefly after adding the toppings.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of freshly kneaded Easy Bread Machine Pizza Dough.  Use a dark, rustic wooden surface with subtle flour dusting.  Natural, soft window light should highlight the dough's smooth, elastic texture.  A shallow depth of field focuses sharply on the center of the dough, blurring the edges.  Include a wooden rolling pin and a sprig of rosemary for rustic charm. Aim for a warm, inviting mood with a color palette of golden browns and deep greens.

video_script.title: Easy Bread Machine Pizza Dough
video_script.description: Make delicious pizza dough from scratch with your bread machine!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a golden-brown, crispy pizza with melted cheese and colorful toppings. Focus on the texture and delicious appearance.
scenes.voice_over: Craving pizza? Skip the takeout and make your own delicious pizza dough at home with just a few simple ingredients and your bread machine. Let's get started!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all the ingredients arranged neatly on a wooden table: bread flour, yeast, salt, sugar, olive oil, and warm water in a glass measuring cup.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: 2 teaspoons of active dry yeast, 3 cups of bread flour, 1 teaspoon of salt, 2 tablespoons of sugar, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 cup of warm water, and an additional 2 tablespoons of warm water.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of ingredients being added to the bread machine in the specified order: yeast, flour, salt, sugar, olive oil, and then water.
scenes.voice_over: Add all the ingredients to your bread machine in the order listed. Make sure your yeast isn't expired. This is important for a good rise!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the bread machine settings, highlighting the "dough" cycle selection.
scenes.voice_over: Select the dough cycle on your bread machine and press start. This will typically take around 1.5-2 hours depending on your machine.

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of the dough being removed from the bread machine and placed in a greased bowl. The dough is smooth and elastic.
scenes.voice_over: Once the cycle is complete, remove the dough from the machine and place it in a well-greased bowl. Roll the dough around to coat it in oil. Cover the bowl and let it rise in a warm place for about 30 minutes. This will give you a light and airy crust.

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of hands gently kneading the risen dough on a lightly floured surface.
scenes.voice_over: Lightly knead the dough for a minute or two, then roll it out into a circle on a lightly greased baking sheet or pizza pan.

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of the rolled-out dough on a pizza pan going into a preheated oven.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 225 degrees Celsius or 437 degrees Fahrenheit. For an extra crispy crust, you can pre-bake the dough for a few minutes before adding your toppings.

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of the pizza with toppings being added. Include a variety of colorful toppings such as tomato sauce, cheese, vegetables, and pepperoni.
scenes.voice_over: Now comes the fun part! Get creative and add your favorite toppings. Whether it's classic pepperoni, fresh veggies, or gourmet cheeses, the possibilities are endless.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished pizza, golden brown and bubbly, coming out of the oven. Steam is rising from the hot pizza.
scenes.voice_over: Bake your pizza for about 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of the finished pizza being sliced and served with a fresh salad and drinks.
scenes.voice_over: Slice your pizza and enjoy! This recipe makes about two 12-inch pizzas, perfect for sharing with friends and family.  Each serving contains approximately 250 calories, 8g of protein, 45g of carbs, and 5g of fat.

cooking_tips: For a thinner crust, roll the dough out very thinly.
Use a pizza stone or baking sheet for best results.
Get creative with your toppings! Try different cheeses, vegetables, meats, and sauces.

recipes.name: Butter-Beer Shrimp Scampi
ingredients: 2 lbs large shrimp, peeled, deveined, and tails removed
directions: Step 1: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Step 2: Add the minced garlic and sauté for about 30 seconds, until fragrant, being careful not to burn it.
Step 3: Add the dried oregano, basil, thyme, cayenne pepper, and crushed red pepper flakes to the skillet.  Cook for another 30 seconds, stirring constantly, until fragrant.
Step 4: Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until they turn pink and opaque, about 3-5 minutes per side depending on the size of the shrimp.
Step 5: Pour in the beer and simmer for 1 minute, allowing the sauce to thicken slightly.
Step 6: Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Step 7: Serve immediately over pasta, rice, or with crusty bread.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of Butter-Beer Shrimp Scampi glistening in a shallow, white ceramic bowl.  The shrimp should be artfully arranged, showcasing their plump texture. Use soft, diffused lighting to highlight the golden butter sauce and vibrant red pepper flakes. Incorporate a rustic wooden background and dark linen napkin. Garnish with fresh parsley sprigs.  Shallow depth of field, focused on the foreground shrimp, creating a creamy, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Butter-Beer Shrimp Scampi
video_script.description: A quick and easy recipe for a flavorful Butter-Beer Shrimp Scampi dish.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished plate of Butter-Beer Shrimp Scampi served over linguine, garnished with fresh parsley. Steam rises enticingly from the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Indulge in this quick and delicious Butter-Beer Shrimp Scampi, ready in under 20 minutes!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden cutting board.  Focus on the fresh shrimp, butter, beer, and spices.
scenes.voice_over: For this recipe, you'll need 2 lbs of large shrimp, 4 tablespoons of butter, minced garlic, dried oregano, basil, thyme, cayenne, and crushed red pepper flakes, salt, pepper, and half a cup of your favorite lager or pilsner.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a skillet with melted butter, minced garlic sizzling gently in the center.
scenes.voice_over: Start by melting 4 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 2 teaspoons of minced garlic and sauté for about 30 seconds until fragrant.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the skillet with the spices being added to the garlic butter mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Add the dried oregano, basil, thyme, cayenne pepper, and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook for another 30 seconds, stirring constantly.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the shrimp being added to the skillet with spices and sizzling.
scenes.voice_over: Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 3-5 minutes per side, until they turn pink and opaque.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the beer being poured into the skillet, creating a light foam on top.
scenes.voice_over: Now, pour in half a cup of beer. Let it simmer for about a minute to thicken the sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished dish in the skillet, beautifully coated in the sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately over pasta, rice, or with some crusty bread.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead wide shot of a table setting with the finished Butter-Beer Shrimp Scampi served over linguine, rice, and crusty bread. Include serving utensils and napkins for an inviting presentation.
scenes.voice_over: This Butter-Beer Shrimp Scampi is a delightful meal with 350 calories, 25 grams of protein, 10 grams of carbs, and 20 grams of fat per serving. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use a dark beer like a stout or porter.
If you don't have beer on hand, you can substitute chicken broth or white wine.
Serve this dish with a side of crusty bread for dipping in the delicious sauce.

recipes.name: Hearty Hamburger Soup
directions: Step 1: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, brown the ground beef over medium-high heat. Drain off any excess fat.
Step 2: Add the salt, pepper, oregano, basil, seasoning salt, and onion soup mix to the browned beef. Stir well to combine.
Step 3: Pour in the boiling water, tomato sauce, and soy sauce. Stir and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Step 4: Cover the pot and simmer for 15 minutes.
Step 5: Add the sliced celery, celery leaves, sliced carrots, and split peas to the simmering soup. Continue to cook for 30 minutes, or until the peas are tender.
Step 6: Stir in the elbow macaroni and simmer for another 30 minutes, or until the macaroni is cooked through. Add more water if needed to maintain desired consistency, stirring occasionally.
Step 7: Serve hot, sprinkled with grated Parmesan cheese.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a steaming bowl of hearty hamburger soup, garnished with fresh parsley, against a rustic wooden backdrop. Utilize a shallow depth of field, focusing on the chunks of beef and vegetables, blurring the background slightly.  Employ warm, natural lighting to highlight the rich colors and textures of the soup.  Incorporate a crusty bread roll and a linen napkin as props.  Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the inviting depth and texture of the soup, creating a cozy and comforting mood.

video_script.title: Hearty Hamburger Soup: A Flavorful and Easy Meal
video_script.description: Warm up with this comforting and easy-to-make Hearty Hamburger Soup. Packed with flavor and simple ingredients, it's a perfect weeknight dinner.

scenes.image_prompt: A close-up shot of a steaming bowl of hearty hamburger soup, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese. The background is a rustic wooden table with a checkered tablecloth. Focus on the rich colors and textures of the soup.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a hearty and delicious hamburger soup, perfect for a chilly evening. This recipe is easy to follow and packed with flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: A flat lay of all the ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden surface. Group related ingredients, like spices together, and produce together.  Ground beef should be prominently displayed.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: Ground beef, onion soup mix, tomato sauce, soy sauce, celery, carrots, split peas, elbow macaroni, and a few basic spices. Plus, Parmesan cheese for garnish.

scenes.image_prompt: Ground beef browning in a Dutch oven or large saucepan over medium-high heat. Steam rising from the pan.
scenes.voice_over: In a large pot or Dutch oven, brown 2 pounds of ground beef over medium-high heat. Drain off any excess fat.

scenes.image_prompt: Spices being added to the browned ground beef in the pot. Close-up shot of the spices being sprinkled.
scenes.voice_over: Add salt, pepper, oregano, basil, seasoning salt, and the onion soup mix to the browned beef.  Stir well to combine these flavors.

scenes.image_prompt: Boiling water, tomato sauce, and soy sauce being poured into the pot with the beef and spices.  Steam rising as the liquids are added.
scenes.voice_over: Pour in 6 cups of boiling water, the tomato sauce, and soy sauce. Give it a good stir and bring the mixture to a simmer.

scenes.image_prompt: Chopped celery, celery leaves, and carrots being added to the simmering soup. Close-up shot of the vegetables being added.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add the celery, celery leaves, carrots, and split peas. Cover the pot and let it simmer for 30 minutes, or until the peas are tender.

scenes.image_prompt: Elbow macaroni being added to the soup pot.
scenes.voice_over: Stir in the elbow macaroni and continue simmering for another 30 minutes, until the macaroni is cooked through. Add a little more water if needed to maintain your desired consistency, stirring occasionally.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a bowl of finished hearty hamburger soup being garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Ladle the soup into bowls and serve it hot, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: A finished bowl of hamburger soup next to a crusty bread roll on a placemat.
scenes.voice_over: This hearty hamburger soup is a complete meal on its own, but it's also delicious served with a crusty bread roll or a side salad. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use beef broth instead of water.
If you prefer a thicker soup, you can mash some of the cooked split peas against the side of the pot before adding the macaroni.
To save time, you can use pre-chopped vegetables.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Pot Roast with Creamy Mushroom Gravy
ingredients: 2 (10.75 ounce) cans condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix
directions: Step 1: In a slow cooker, combine the condensed cream of mushroom soup, dry onion soup mix, and water.
Step 2: Place the beef pot roast in the slow cooker and coat it with the soup mixture.
Step 3: Cook on High for 3 to 4 hours, or on Low for 8 to 9 hours.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a slow cooker pot roast bathed in creamy mushroom gravy. Style the sliced roast on a rustic wooden board, cascading with gravy and surrounded by roasted root vegetables. Utilize soft, natural light from the side to highlight the tender meat and rich gravy. A shallow depth of field focuses on the glistening surface of the sliced roast, while the background features a blurred linen napkin and vintage cutlery. Garnish with fresh thyme sprigs.  The mood should be warm, inviting, and comforting. Aim for a slightly overhead, three-quarters angle to showcase the textures and depth of the dish.

video_script.title: Slow Cooker Pot Roast with Creamy Mushroom Gravy
video_script.description: A simple and delicious recipe for tender pot roast in a rich and creamy mushroom gravy, made entirely in your slow cooker.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a perfectly cooked pot roast, sliced and covered in a creamy mushroom gravy. The meat is fork-tender and juicy, and the gravy is thick and flavorful. A side of mashed potatoes is visible in the background.
scenes.voice_over: Craving a comforting, flavorful meal that requires minimal effort? Look no further than this Slow Cooker Pot Roast with Creamy Mushroom Gravy. Tender, juicy pot roast bathed in a rich and savory gravy, it's the perfect weeknight dinner.

scenes.image_prompt: Display the ingredients: Two cans of cream of mushroom soup, a packet of onion soup mix, water, and a beef pot roast. Arrange them neatly on a wooden cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: For this recipe, you'll need two cans of condensed cream of mushroom soup, one packet of dry onion soup mix, one and a quarter cups of water, and a five-and-a-half-pound beef pot roast.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the inside of a slow cooker. Cream of mushroom soup, onion soup mix, and water are being combined inside it.
scenes.voice_over: In your slow cooker, combine the condensed cream of mushroom soup, dry onion soup mix, and water. Whisk them together until they're well incorporated.

scenes.image_prompt: A beef pot roast is placed inside the slow cooker, and the soup mixture is being poured over it to coat it completely.
scenes.voice_over: Place the beef pot roast in the slow cooker and ensure it's fully coated with the soup mixture. This will ensure the roast stays moist and absorbs all the delicious flavors.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a slow cooker with its settings displayed. The text "High for 3-4 hours" or "Low for 8-9 hours" is superimposed.
scenes.voice_over: Cover and cook on high for 3 to 4 hours, or on low for 8 to 9 hours, or until the beef is fork-tender.  The longer cooking time on low will result in an even more tender and flavorful roast.

scenes.image_prompt: The pot roast is being carefully removed from the slow cooker. It is fork-tender and easily pulls apart.
scenes.voice_over: Once the cooking time is complete, check the roast for tenderness. It should easily pull apart with a fork.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the pot roast being shredded with two forks.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the pot roast from the slow cooker and shred it with two forks.  Return the shredded beef to the slow cooker and mix it with the gravy.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished dish, shredded pot roast covered in creamy mushroom gravy, is served with mashed potatoes. A sprinkle of fresh parsley garnishes the dish. Close-up shot emphasizing the delicious gravy.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your Slow Cooker Pot Roast with Creamy Mushroom Gravy over mashed potatoes, rice, or noodles. Garnish with fresh parsley for a touch of freshness. Each serving contains approximately 400 calories, 30 grams of protein, 20 grams of carbs, and 20 grams of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a thicker gravy, remove the pot roast after cooking and whisk 1-2 tablespoons of cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of cold water until smooth.  Stir this mixture into the gravy in the slow cooker and cook on high for another 15-20 minutes, or until thickened.
Serve the pot roast with mashed potatoes, roasted vegetables, or egg noodles.

recipes.name: Sesame Noodles with Funky Chicken
ingredients: 1 teaspoon fresh ginger, chopped (or 1/4 teaspoon dried ginger)
directions: 1. Prepare the sesame noodles: Cook spaghettini according to package directions.
2. Drain the pasta and rinse (optional).
3. In a jar, combine soy sauce, sesame oil, and granulated sugar.
4. Shake well until the sugar dissolves.
5. Pour the sauce over the cooked pasta and toss to coat.
6. Add sliced scallions and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Set aside.
7. Marinate the chicken: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, teriyaki sauce, minced garlic, brown sugar, and ginger.
8. Ensure the brown sugar is mostly dissolved.
9. Add the chicken breasts to the marinade, ensuring they are fully coated.
10. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for 2-3 hours.
11. Cook the chicken: Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the used marinade.
12. Heat sesame oil in a large non-stick pan over medium-high heat.
13. Sauté the chicken in batches for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through, adding more sesame oil as needed.
14. Remove the chicken from the pan and let it rest briefly.
15. Slice the chicken diagonally into thin strips.
16. Serve the sliced chicken over the sesame noodles.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant, close-up shot of Sesame Noodles with Funky Chicken.  Glossy spaghettini, coated in sesame seeds and glistening with oil, twirls around pieces of caramelized chicken.  Use a dark, textured background with natural, side lighting to highlight the texture of the noodles and the golden hue of the chicken.  Garnish with sliced scallions and scattered sesame seeds.  Shallow depth of field, focusing sharply on the chicken and foreground noodles, creating a soft, inviting mood.  Include chopsticks subtly placed to suggest recent enjoyment.

video_script.title: Sesame Noodles with Funky Chicken
video_script.description: A quick and easy recipe for delicious sesame noodles topped with flavorful, marinated chicken.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished plate of sesame noodles with funky chicken. Noodles are coated in a glistening sesame sauce, topped with vibrant green scallions, sesame seeds, and tender, sliced chicken. Focus on the textures and colors of the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Craving a flavorful and satisfying meal? Look no further! Today, we're making sesame noodles with funky chicken – a perfect blend of savory, sweet, and a little bit tangy.  Get ready for a flavor explosion!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ingredient groups arranged neatly on a clean surface. Group 1: spaghettini, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar. Group 2: scallions, sesame seeds. Group 3: chicken breasts, soy sauce, teriyaki sauce, garlic, brown sugar, ginger. A small pan with sesame oil sits to the side.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need. For the noodles: thin spaghettini, soy sauce, sesame oil, and granulated sugar. For the chicken marinade: soy sauce, teriyaki sauce, garlic, brown sugar, ginger, and of course, chicken breasts.  And don't forget those all-important scallions and sesame seeds for garnish!

scenes.image_prompt: Pot of boiling water with spaghettini being added.
scenes.voice_over: First, cook your spaghettini according to package directions until al dente.  A little tip: rinsing the noodles with cold water afterwards will prevent them from sticking together.

scenes.image_prompt: Close up of a jar with soy sauce, sesame oil, and sugar being combined. Show the shaking of the jar vigorously.
scenes.voice_over: While the pasta cooks, let's make that irresistible sesame sauce. Combine soy sauce, sesame oil, and granulated sugar in a jar. Shake it like a polaroid picture until the sugar dissolves completely.

scenes.image_prompt: The cooked noodles being tossed in the sesame sauce, then garnished with scallions and sesame seeds.
scenes.voice_over: Drain the pasta and toss it with our freshly made sesame sauce.  Make sure every strand is beautifully coated. Sprinkle with sliced scallions and sesame seeds. Set aside for now.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken breasts marinating in a bowl with the marinade ingredients.
scenes.voice_over: Now for the funky chicken! Whisk together soy sauce, teriyaki sauce, minced garlic, brown sugar, and ginger.  Make sure the brown sugar dissolves as much as possible for maximum flavor. Add the chicken breasts, ensuring they're fully submerged in the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 2-3 hours for optimal flavor infusion.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken being sautéed in a pan with sesame oil.
scenes.voice_over: After marinating, remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the used marinade. Heat sesame oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Sauté the chicken for about 5-7 minutes per side, or until fully cooked. Add more sesame oil if needed. Remember to avoid overcrowding the pan. Cook in batches if necessary.

scenes.image_prompt: Sliced chicken arranged over a bed of sesame noodles.
scenes.voice_over: Once cooked, let the chicken rest for a few minutes before slicing it diagonally into thin strips. Finally, arrange the sliced chicken over your bed of sesame noodles.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished dish, garnished with extra sesame seeds and scallions, with chopsticks placed invitingly on the side. A glass of chilled beverage is also included.
scenes.voice_over: Your Sesame Noodles with Funky Chicken is ready to serve!  For an extra kick, garnish with a few more sesame seeds and scallions.  I recommend pairing this with a refreshing iced tea or a light beer. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer sesame flavor, toast the sesame seeds before sprinkling them over the noodles.
If you don't have fresh ginger, you can substitute with 1/4 teaspoon of ground ginger.
Adjust the amount of sesame oil in the noodle sauce to your preference.
Don't overcrowd the pan when sautéing the chicken. Cook in batches to ensure even browning.

recipes.name: Bacon-Wrapped Chicken with Chive and Onion Cream Cheese
ingredients: 2 (8 ounce) cartons chive and onion cream cheese
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a baking pan.
Step 2: Flatten each chicken breast half to 1/2-inch thickness.
Step 3: Spread approximately 3 tablespoons of chive and onion cream cheese over each flattened chicken breast.
Step 4: Dot each chicken breast with a small amount of butter and sprinkle with salt.
Step 5: Roll up each chicken breast and wrap with a slice of bacon, placing seam-down in the prepared baking pan.
Step 6: Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.
Step 7: Broil for 5 minutes, 6 inches from the heat, or until the bacon is crisp.

Step 8: (Optional) To freeze for later use, arrange the uncooked, bacon-wrapped chicken breasts on a cookie sheet and freeze until solid. Then, wrap individually or in desired quantities and store in a ziplock bag or vacuum seal.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture bacon-wrapped chicken breasts stuffed with chive and onion cream cheese, plated on a rustic wooden board. Use soft, diffused lighting to highlight the golden bacon and creamy filling. Garnish with fresh chives and a sprinkle of sea salt. Employ a shallow depth of field, focusing on the sliced chicken revealing the filling, with the bacon slightly blurred.  The background should be dark and moody, creating a sense of richness and warmth. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase the dish's textures and layers.

video_script.title: Bacon-Wrapped Chicken with Chive and Onion Cream Cheese
video_script.description: A quick and easy recipe for delicious bacon-wrapped chicken breasts filled with chive and onion cream cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of several finished bacon-wrapped chicken breasts, golden brown and crispy, plated on a bed of rice pilaf with a garnish of fresh chives.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making juicy, bacon-wrapped chicken breasts filled with flavorful chive and onion cream cheese. This recipe is perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a clean countertop.  Focus on the chicken breasts, cream cheese, bacon, butter, and salt.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: boneless, skinless chicken breasts, chive and onion cream cheese, butter, salt, and bacon slices.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a person flattening a chicken breast with a meat mallet, between two sheets of plastic wrap.
scenes.voice_over: First, preheat your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Then, flatten each chicken breast to about half an inch thick. This helps them cook evenly and makes rolling easier.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of spreading cream cheese on the flattened chicken breasts.
scenes.voice_over: Spread a generous amount of chive and onion cream cheese onto each chicken breast, about 3 tablespoons each.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken breast topped with cream cheese, being dotted with butter and sprinkled with salt.
scenes.voice_over: Dot each chicken breast with butter and sprinkle with salt to enhance the flavors.

scenes.image_prompt: Demonstration of rolling the chicken breasts and wrapping them with bacon.
scenes.voice_over: Roll up each chicken breast and wrap it with a slice of bacon, seam-down. Place them in a greased baking pan.

scenes.image_prompt: The baking pan with the bacon-wrapped chicken in the oven.
scenes.voice_over: Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.

scenes.image_prompt: The baking pan under the broiler.
scenes.voice_over: For extra crispy bacon, broil for the last 5 minutes, keeping the pan about 6 inches from the heat source.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of finished dish, showing how to slice into it to reveal the creamy filling.
scenes.voice_over: Let the chicken rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving. These bacon-wrapped chicken breasts pair perfectly with roasted vegetables, rice, or mashed potatoes.

scenes.image_prompt: Finished bacon-wrapped chicken breasts, plated with suggested side dishes like roasted asparagus and mashed potatoes.
scenes.voice_over: And there you have it! A simple yet elegant meal that's sure to impress. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra flavor, try adding a sprinkle of garlic powder or onion powder before wrapping the chicken in bacon.
If you don't have chive and onion cream cheese, plain cream cheese can be substituted. You can also add your own chopped chives and onions to the cream cheese.

recipes.name: Jo Mama's World-Famous Spaghetti
ingredients: 2 lbs Italian sausage, casings removed (mild or hot)
directions: Step 1: In a large, heavy stockpot, brown the Italian sausage over medium heat, breaking it up with a spoon as it cooks. If using onions, add them to the pot once the sausage is browned and cook until softened.
Step 2: Add the minced garlic to the pot and cook for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Step 3: Stir in the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, and water. Add the dried basil, dried parsley, brown sugar, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, and black pepper. Stir well to combine.
Step 4: Bring the sauce to a gentle simmer, then reduce heat to low. Stir in the red wine.
Step 5: Simmer the sauce uncovered for at least 1 hour, stirring occasionally. For a richer flavor, simmer for a longer period, but be careful not to let it burn.
Step 6: While the sauce simmers, cook the spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
Step 7: Drain the cooked spaghetti and serve topped with the sauce and grated Parmesan cheese.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture Jo Mama's World-Famous Spaghetti in a rustic, inviting setting.  Use a dark wood table with a linen napkin and vintage silverware.  Style the spaghetti twirled around a fork, glistening with sauce, against a backdrop of the simmering sauce in a cast iron pot.  Focus on the foreground spaghetti, with a shallow depth of field blurring the background.  Warm, natural lighting should highlight the rich tomato hues and sausage texture. Garnish with fresh basil sprigs. Aim for a cozy, comforting mood.

video_script.title: Jo Mama's World-Famous Spaghetti
video_script.description: A rich and flavorful spaghetti recipe passed down through generations.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate of Jo Mama's World-Famous Spaghetti, garnished with fresh parsley and grated Parmesan cheese. Steam rises from the dish, highlighting the rich tomato sauce and savory sausage.
scenes.voice_over: Get ready for a taste of heaven with Jo Mama's World-Famous Spaghetti! This recipe is a family favorite, packed with flavor and guaranteed to warm your soul.

scenes.image_prompt: Italian sausage, a chopped onion, and minced garlic arranged on a wooden cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: Let's gather our ingredients. You'll need Italian sausage, onion, garlic, canned diced tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, water, and a blend of herbs and spices including basil, parsley, brown sugar, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, and black pepper.  A splash of red wine adds depth, and of course, don't forget the spaghetti and Parmesan cheese!

scenes.image_prompt: Sausage browning in a large stockpot over medium heat.
scenes.voice_over: In a large stockpot, brown the Italian sausage over medium heat for about 8-10 minutes, breaking it up with a spoon.  If you're using onions, add them once the sausage is browned and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Garlic being added to the pot with browned sausage and onions.
scenes.voice_over: Add the minced garlic and cook for about 30 seconds until fragrant. Don't burn the garlic!

scenes.image_prompt: All the canned tomato products and water being added to the pot with the sausage mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, and water.  This creates the base of our delicious sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Dried herbs and spices being added to the sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Next, add the dried basil, dried parsley, brown sugar, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, and black pepper. Stir well to combine all those amazing flavors.

scenes.image_prompt: Red wine being stirred into the simmering sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Bring the sauce to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and stir in the red wine. Let it simmer uncovered for at least 1 hour, or longer for an even richer flavor. Stir occasionally.

scenes.image_prompt: Spaghetti being cooked in a pot of boiling water.
scenes.voice_over: While the sauce simmers, cook your spaghetti according to package directions until perfectly al dente.

scenes.image_prompt: A plate of spaghetti topped with the rich tomato sauce, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Drain the cooked spaghetti and serve it topped with that amazing sauce and plenty of grated Parmesan cheese. Enjoy!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of twirling spaghetti with the sauce, ready to be enjoyed. A glass of red wine sits next to the plate. In the background, there is a family-style dinner setting.
scenes.voice_over: Jo Mama's World-Famous Spaghetti is perfect for a cozy weeknight dinner or a special occasion. Share it with your loved ones and create lasting memories. Buon appetito!

cooking_tips: For a smoother sauce, use an immersion blender to partially blend the sauce after simmering.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed. You may want to add more salt, pepper, or red pepper flakes depending on your preference.
If the sauce becomes too thick, add a little more water to thin it out.

recipes.name: Classic Easy Lasagna
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease a 13x9 inch baking dish.
Step 2: Spread a thin layer of spaghetti sauce in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
Step 3: Arrange 3 lasagna noodles over the sauce.
Step 4: In a medium bowl, combine the cottage cheese, egg, and parmesan cheese.
Step 5: Spread one-third of the cottage cheese mixture over the noodles.
Step 6: Top with one-third of the remaining spaghetti sauce and sprinkle with 1 cup of mozzarella cheese.
Step 7: Repeat layers twice more: 3 noodles, one-third cottage cheese mixture, one-third sauce, and 1 cup mozzarella cheese.
Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven for 60 minutes, or until the lasagna is bubbly and the cheese is melted and lightly browned.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a classic easy lasagna, freshly baked and bubbling, in a dark, rustic baking dish. Focus on the cheesy, layered interior, pulling a single serving onto a spatula with cheese stretching appealingly. Use a shallow depth of field to highlight the melted mozzarella and ricotta filling.  Employ warm, inviting lighting from the side, showcasing the texture of the noodles and sauce. Garnish with fresh basil sprigs and grated parmesan. Compose the shot with a slightly overhead, close-up angle against a dark, textured background for a comforting, home-style mood.

video_script.title: Classic Easy Lasagna
video_script.description: A quick and easy lasagna recipe perfect for any weeknight meal.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished lasagna dish, bubbly, golden brown, and garnished with fresh parsley. Steam gently rises from the dish.
scenes.voice_over: Craving lasagna but short on time? This classic easy lasagna recipe is your answer! It's cheesy, comforting, and ready in just about an hour.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: lasagna noodles, jar of spaghetti sauce, cottage cheese, egg, parmesan cheese, and mozzarella cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: lasagna noodles, your favorite jar of spaghetti sauce, cottage cheese, an egg, parmesan, and plenty of mozzarella cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: Greased 13x9 inch baking dish.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Lightly grease a 13x9 inch baking dish.

scenes.image_prompt: A thin layer of spaghetti sauce being spread in the bottom of the baking dish.
scenes.voice_over: Start with a thin layer of sauce in the bottom of your dish. This prevents the noodles from sticking.

scenes.image_prompt: Three lasagna noodles being arranged over the sauce in the baking dish.
scenes.voice_over: Place three lasagna noodles over the sauce, slightly overlapping if needed.

scenes.image_prompt: Cottage cheese, egg, and parmesan cheese being mixed together in a bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, combine the cottage cheese, egg, and parmesan cheese. Mix well.

scenes.image_prompt: Layering the lasagna: one-third of the cottage cheese mixture spread over the noodles, followed by sauce, and mozzarella.
scenes.voice_over: Spread one-third of the cottage cheese mixture over the noodles. Top with one-third of the spaghetti sauce and a generous cup of mozzarella cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: Repeating layers of noodles, cheese mixture, sauce, and mozzarella.
scenes.voice_over: Repeat the layering process two more times: noodles, cottage cheese mixture, sauce, and mozzarella. Make sure you end with a cheesy top layer.

scenes.image_prompt: Lasagna baking in the preheated oven.
scenes.voice_over: Bake for 60 minutes, or until bubbly and golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished lasagna, golden brown and bubbly, being sliced and served.
scenes.voice_over: Let it rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving. This easy lasagna is delicious on its own or with a side salad. Each serving has approximately 350 calories, 25g of protein, 35g of carbs and 15g of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese.
Add cooked ground beef or Italian sausage to the sauce for a heartier lasagna.
Cover the lasagna with foil for the first 45 minutes of baking to prevent over-browning.

recipes.name: Mama's Supper Club Parmesan Crusted Tilapia
ingredients: 2 lbs tilapia fillets (or orange roughy, cod, or red snapper)
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 2: Lightly butter a 13x9 inch baking dish.
Step 3: Arrange tilapia fillets in a single layer in the prepared baking dish. Do not overlap.
Step 4: Brush the tops of the fillets with lemon juice.
Step 5: In a medium bowl, combine Parmesan cheese, softened butter, mayonnaise, green onions, seasoning salt, basil, pepper, and hot sauce. Mix well.
Step 6: Bake the fish for 10-15 minutes, or until it just begins to flake.
Step 7: Remove from oven and spread the Parmesan cheese mixture evenly over the fish.
Step 8: Return to the oven and bake for another 5-7 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the fish is cooked through.
Step 9: Watch carefully to prevent overcooking. Cooking time may vary depending on the thickness of the fillets.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture Mama's Supper Club Parmesan Crusted Tilapia: two golden-brown, flaky fillets on a rustic wooden board, garnished with fresh green onions and a lemon wedge.  Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the foreground fillet's textured crust. Soft, directional lighting should highlight the parmesan's golden hue and the fish's moistness.
