video_script.title: Mama's Supper Club Parmesan Crusted Tilapia
video_script.description: A quick and easy recipe for delicious parmesan crusted tilapia.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished plate of Mama's Supper Club Parmesan Crusted Tilapia, garnished with fresh parsley and lemon wedges. The golden-brown crust is bubbling slightly, and the fish looks flaky and moist.
scenes.text: Mama's Supper Club Parmesan Crusted Tilapia
scenes.voice_over: Tonight, we're making Mama's Supper Club Parmesan Crusted Tilapia! This recipe is simple, yet elegant, perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ingredients arranged neatly on a wooden cutting board: tilapia fillets, lemon, Parmesan cheese, butter, mayonnaise, green onions, seasoning salt, basil, black pepper, and hot sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: Tilapia fillets, fresh lemon, Parmesan cheese, softened butter, mayonnaise, green onions, Old Bay seasoning, dried basil, black pepper, and a dash of hot sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: A lightly buttered 13x9 inch baking dish.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and lightly butter a 13x9 inch baking dish.

scenes.image_prompt: Tilapia fillets arranged in a single layer in the prepared baking dish. The fillets should not overlap.
scenes.voice_over: Arrange your tilapia fillets in a single layer in the baking dish. Make sure they don't overlap so they cook evenly.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of brushing lemon juice over the tilapia fillets.
scenes.voice_over: Brush the tops of the fillets with fresh lemon juice for extra flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: A medium bowl with Parmesan cheese, softened butter, mayonnaise, green onions, seasoning salt, basil, pepper, and hot sauce being mixed together.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, combine Parmesan cheese, softened butter, mayonnaise, chopped green onions, Old Bay seasoning, basil, black pepper, and a dash of hot sauce. Mix well.

scenes.image_prompt: The baking dish with the tilapia fillets baking in the preheated oven.
scenes.voice_over: Bake the fish for 10-15 minutes, until it just begins to flake.

scenes.image_prompt: The Parmesan cheese mixture being spread evenly over the baked tilapia fillets.
scenes.voice_over: Remove from the oven and spread the Parmesan mixture evenly over the fish.

scenes.image_prompt: The baking dish with the tilapia and parmesan topping baking in the oven until golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Return to the oven and bake for another 5-7 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the fish is cooked through. Watch carefully to prevent overcooking.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished plate of Mama's Supper Club Parmesan Crusted Tilapia, garnished with fresh parsley and lemon wedges, served with a side of rice and steamed asparagus.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious parmesan crusted tilapia with your favorite sides, like rice pilaf or steamed asparagus. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a crispier topping, broil the fish for the last 2-3 minutes of cooking.
Serve with a side of rice pilaf and steamed vegetables for a complete meal.
Substitute other white fish like cod, orange roughy or red snapper if tilapia isn't available.

recipes.name: Perfectly Roasted Prime Rib
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Combine salt, rosemary, horseradish powder, garlic powder, and black pepper in a small bowl.
Step 3: Rub the seasoning mixture evenly over the entire surface of the prime rib roast.
Step 4: Place the seasoned roast, fat-side up, in a roasting pan with a rack.
Step 5: Roast for 45 minutes.
Step 6: Turn the oven off, and leave the roast in the oven, undisturbed, for 1 hour.

Step 7: Turn the oven back on to 375°F (190°C), and continue roasting for approximately 45 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches your desired doneness (120-125°F for rare, 130-135°F for medium-rare, 140-145°F for medium).
Step 8: Remove the roast from the oven and let it rest for 15-20 minutes before carving. This allows the juices to redistribute, resulting in a more tender and flavorful roast.
Step 9: Scrape off the hardened salt crust before carving.
Step 10: Serve with au jus and horseradish sauce.

nutrition.calories: Varies depending on roast size and serving

recipes.image_prompt: Capture a perfectly roasted prime rib, seasoned with rosemary, garlic, and horseradish, resting on a dark wooden cutting board.  Use chiaroscuro lighting to emphasize the crust's texture and the rosy interior.  Garnish with fresh rosemary sprigs.  A shallow depth of field should focus on the sliced portion, revealing the tender, juicy meat.  The background should be dark and moody, with subtle highlights on the surrounding props, perhaps including a vintage carving set. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle, showcasing the roast's impressive size and perfect doneness.

video_script.title: Perfectly Roasted Prime Rib
video_script.description: Learn how to make a juicy and flavorful prime rib roast with a simple salt crust. Perfect for holiday gatherings or special occasions.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a perfectly roasted prime rib, sliced to reveal a beautiful pink center, resting on a carving board with sprigs of rosemary and thyme. Include a carving knife and fork.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today we're making an impressive, yet easy, perfectly roasted prime rib with a delicious herb crust.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: prime rib roast, kosher salt, dried rosemary, horseradish powder, garlic powder, and black pepper.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: a 3-5 pound prime rib roast, kosher salt, dried rosemary, horseradish powder, garlic powder, and black pepper.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of hands combining the dry ingredients in a bowl, mixing with a spoon.
scenes.voice_over: Combine the salt, rosemary, horseradish powder, garlic powder, and pepper in a bowl. Mix well.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of hands rubbing the spice mixture onto the prime rib, ensuring it's evenly coated.
scenes.voice_over: Pat the prime rib dry and generously rub the spice mixture all over the roast, ensuring it's evenly coated.

scenes.image_prompt: Prime rib placed fat-side up in a roasting pan with a rack.
scenes.voice_over: Place the seasoned roast, fat-side up, in a roasting pan with a rack.

scenes.image_prompt: The roasting pan being placed in a preheated oven.
scenes.voice_over: Roast in a preheated oven at 375°F for 45 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Visual representation of turning the oven off. A graphic with oven and a timer could also illustrate this step.
scenes.voice_over: Turn the oven off and leave the roast undisturbed inside for 1 hour.

scenes.image_prompt: Visual representation of turning the oven on. Include a timer on screen. Alternatively, show the oven door closing, to indicate resumption of the cooking process.
scenes.voice_over: Turn the oven back on to 375°F and roast for another 45 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches your desired doneness. Use a meat thermometer to check - 120-125°F for rare, 130-135°F for medium-rare, and 140-145°F for medium.

scenes.image_prompt: The roasted prime rib resting on a cutting board, tent loosely with foil.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the roast from the oven and let it rest for 15-20 minutes before carving. This allows the juices to redistribute.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of scraping the salt crust off the roast before slicing.
scenes.voice_over: Gently scrape off the hardened salt crust before carving.

scenes.image_prompt: Sliced prime rib arranged on a platter, garnished with rosemary sprigs, served with au jus and horseradish sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your perfectly roasted prime rib with au jus and horseradish sauce. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: Use a meat thermometer to ensure accurate doneness.
Letting the roast rest is crucial for a juicy and tender final product.
The salt crust helps to season the meat and create a flavorful exterior, but it should be removed before serving.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Down-Home Pork Chops with Gravy
directions: Step 1: In a shallow dish, combine the flour, dry mustard, salt, and garlic powder.
Step 2: Dredge the pork chops in the flour mixture and set aside.
Step 3: Pour the remaining flour mixture into the slow cooker.
Step 4: Whisk in the chicken broth until smooth.
Step 5: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 6: Brown the pork chops on both sides in the hot oil.
Step 7: Place the browned pork chops in the slow cooker.
Step 8: Cover and cook on high for 2 to 3 hours, or on low for 5 to 6 hours, or until the pork chops are tender.
Step 9: If the gravy is too thick, add a little water to thin it out. If it's too thin, whisk a tablespoon of flour with a tablespoon of water and add it to the slow cooker.
Step 10: Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 11: Serve hot with rice or mashed potatoes.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture slow cooker pork chops bathed in rich, savory gravy. Style them nestled among creamy mashed potatoes and vibrant green beans on a rustic wooden board. Use warm, natural lighting to highlight the glistening gravy and tender texture of the pork.  A shallow depth of field focuses on a foreground chop, blurring the background slightly. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh parsley. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the comforting, home-style appeal. Aim for a cozy, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Slow Cooker Down-Home Pork Chops with Gravy
video_script.description: Tender and flavorful pork chops cooked to perfection in a rich and savory gravy, all made easy in your slow cooker.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate of Slow Cooker Down-Home Pork Chops with Gravy, served with a side of fluffy mashed potatoes. The gravy should be rich and inviting, and the pork chops should appear juicy and tender.
scenes.text: Slow Cooker Down-Home Pork Chops with Gravy
scenes.voice_over: Craving comfort food? Look no further! These slow cooker pork chops are smothered in a creamy, flavorful gravy, making them the perfect weeknight meal.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: flour, dry mustard, salt, garlic powder, pork chops, chicken broth, and vegetable oil.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: all-purpose flour, dry mustard, salt, garlic powder, boneless pork chops, condensed chicken broth, and vegetable oil.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a shallow dish with flour, dry mustard, salt, and garlic powder being whisked together.
scenes.voice_over: In a shallow dish, combine the flour, dry mustard, salt, and garlic powder. This will create a flavorful coating for our pork chops and thicken the gravy.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of pork chops being dredged in the flour mixture, ensuring they are fully coated.
scenes.voice_over: Dredge each pork chop in the flour mixture, ensuring it's fully coated on both sides. Set the coated pork chops aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of chicken broth being whisked into remaining flour mixture in the slow cooker until smooth.
scenes.voice_over: Pour any remaining flour mixture into the slow cooker and whisk in the chicken broth until smooth. This forms the base of our delicious gravy.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of pork chops browning in hot oil in a skillet.
scenes.voice_over: Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the pork chops for a couple of minutes per side. This step adds a wonderful depth of flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of browned pork chops being placed in the slow cooker, nestled into the gravy base.
scenes.voice_over: Place the browned pork chops in the slow cooker, ensuring they are nestled into the gravy base. Cover and cook on high for 2 to 3 hours, or on low for 5 to 6 hours, or until the pork chops are fork-tender.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of gravy thickness being checked and adjusted with flour-water mixture or water.
scenes.voice_over: Once the pork chops are cooked, check the gravy's consistency. If it's too thick, thin it out with a bit of water. If it's too thin, whisk together a tablespoon of flour with a tablespoon of water and stir it into the gravy.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished dish plated with a side of fluffy rice or mashed potatoes, garnished with freshly chopped parsley.
scenes.voice_over: Serve these tender, flavorful pork chops hot with a side of rice or mashed potatoes. Garnish with fresh parsley, if desired. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer gravy, use low-sodium chicken broth and add a splash of heavy cream or milk at the end of cooking.

If you prefer a thicker gravy, remove the pork chops from the slow cooker once they are cooked through and whisk together 2 tablespoons of cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of cold water. Stir this mixture into the gravy and cook on high for another 15-20 minutes, or until thickened.

recipes.name: Mama Iuliucci's Famous Italian Meatballs
ingredients: 8-10 slices white bread, broken into small 1/2-inch pieces (or stale bread/rolls)
Olive oil or vegetable oil, for frying
directions: 1. In a large bowl, gently combine ground beef, bread pieces, beaten eggs, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, parsley flakes, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Mix until just combined, do not overmix.
2. Roll the meat mixture into meatballs, approximately 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 inches in diameter.
3. Heat about 1/4 inch of olive oil or vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium heat.
4. Fry the meatballs in the hot oil, rolling them frequently to ensure even browning, until the juices run clear and the internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).

5. Add the cooked meatballs to your favorite sauce (recommended: Mama Iuliucci's "Don't Skip a Step" Spaghetti Sauce) and simmer for a while to allow the flavors to meld. Alternatively, serve the meatballs with your favorite pasta and sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture Mama Iuliucci's Famous Italian Meatballs, glistening with a light sheen of oil, nestled in a rustic, shallow terracotta dish.  Focus sharply on a meatball in the foreground, allowing the rest to softly fall out of focus. Employ warm, natural light from the side to highlight the texture and rich brown color. Garnish with fresh parsley sprigs and a dusting of grated Parmesan. Use a dark, textured wooden background to create a moody, inviting atmosphere. Compose with negative space for a sophisticated feel.  A slightly overhead angle showcasing the roundness of the meatballs is ideal.

video_script.title: Mama Iuliucci's Famous Italian Meatballs
video_script.description: Learn to make Mama Iuliucci's Famous Italian Meatballs, a treasured family recipe passed down through generations. These juicy, flavorful meatballs are perfect for pasta, subs, or even on their own!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate of steaming spaghetti topped with Mama Iuliucci's Famous Italian Meatballs, garnished with fresh parsley. The meatballs are browned and juicy, and the sauce is rich and vibrant.
scenes.voice_over: Get ready to learn Mama Iuliucci's secret recipe for the most delicious Italian meatballs you'll ever taste!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: Ground beef, sliced white bread, eggs, grated Parmesan, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, parsley flakes, salt, and pepper.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: 2 lbs lean ground beef, 8-10 slices of white bread, 2 large eggs, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, dried parsley, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.  Don't forget the olive oil for frying!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hands gently combining the ground beef, bread pieces, eggs, and seasonings in a large bowl. Show the texture of the mixture.
scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, gently combine the ground beef, bread pieces, eggs, garlic powder, Italian seasoning, parsley, Parmesan, salt, and pepper. Be careful not to overmix, as this can make the meatballs tough.

scenes.image_prompt: Hands rolling the meat mixture into evenly sized meatballs, approximately 1 1/2 inches in diameter.
scenes.voice_over: Roll the mixture into meatballs about 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 inches in diameter. Try to make them all roughly the same size so they cook evenly.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of meatballs frying in hot olive oil in a pan, being gently rolled for even browning.
scenes.voice_over: Heat about 1/4 inch of olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Fry the meatballs, rolling them frequently to brown all sides, until they reach an internal temperature of 160°F (71°C). This should take about 10-15 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Meatballs simmering in Mama Iuliucci's "Don't Skip a Step" Spaghetti Sauce in a pot.
scenes.voice_over: Add the cooked meatballs to your favorite sauce.  I highly recommend Mama Iuliucci's "Don't Skip a Step" Spaghetti Sauce. Let them simmer for at least 30 minutes to really let the flavors meld.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a plate of spaghetti topped with the finished meatballs, garnished with fresh parsley. A separate bowl of the "Don't Skip a Step" sauce is next to the plate.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious meatballs over your favorite pasta with extra sauce on the side.  Buon appetito!

scenes.image_prompt: A platter of the meatballs next to a toasted sub roll and a small dish of marinara sauce, suggesting an alternative serving method.
scenes.voice_over: Looking for other serving ideas? These meatballs are fantastic in sub sandwiches or even enjoyed on their own as an appetizer.

cooking_tips: For baking or broiling, use a broiler pan to allow fat to drip away from the meatballs.
Adjust the amount of seasonings to taste.
Meatballs can be made ahead and frozen for later use.

recipes.name: Classic Chicken Pot Pie
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Step 2: In a large skillet or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the diced onion, celery, carrots, and potatoes. Sauté for 10 minutes, or until the vegetables are slightly softened.
Step 3: Sprinkle the flour over the sautéed vegetables and stir constantly for 1 minute.
Step 4: Gradually whisk in the chicken broth and half-and-half until smooth. Bring the mixture to a simmer, stirring constantly, until thickened and bubbly.
Step 5: Reduce the heat to low and stir in the salt, pepper, and chopped chicken. Cook for 5 minutes, or until heated through.
Step 6: Pour the chicken mixture into a 2-quart casserole dish. Top with the pie crusts, crimping the edges to seal. Cut several slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape.
Step 7: Bake for 40-50 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
Step 8: Let cool for 10-15 minutes before serving.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a classic chicken pot pie, its golden-brown, flaky crust glistening.  Focus on a slice removed, revealing the creamy, steaming filling of tender chicken, potatoes, carrots, celery, and onion. Use a slightly overhead angle. Soft, natural light from the side should highlight the textures and create a warm, inviting mood. A rustic wooden background and linen napkin enhance the home-cooked feel. Depth of field is shallow, focusing sharply on the exposed filling. Garnish with fresh thyme sprigs.

video_script.title: Classic Chicken Pot Pie Recipe

Focus on the flaky crust and the creamy, savory filling slightly visible through the cuts. Background should be slightly blurred, warm, and inviting, possibly with a checkered tablecloth.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a classic chicken pot pie, a comforting dish perfect for any occasion.  This recipe is easy to follow, even for beginners.

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: potatoes, onions, celery, carrots, butter, flour, chicken broth, half-and-half, salt, pepper, cooked chicken, and pie crusts.

scenes.voice_over: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Melt butter in a Dutch oven, then sauté onions, celery, carrots, and potatoes for 10 minutes until slightly softened.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of flour being sprinkled over the sautéed vegetables, then the mixture being stirred constantly.
scenes.voice_over: Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and stir constantly for 1 minute.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of chicken broth and half-and-half being gradually whisked into the vegetable mixture until smooth. Show the mixture thickening as it simmers.
scenes.voice_over: Gradually whisk in chicken broth and half-and-half until smooth. Bring to a simmer, stirring constantly until thickened and bubbly.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of salt, pepper, and cooked chicken being stirred into the thickened sauce. The chicken should appear tender and juicy.
scenes.voice_over: Reduce heat to low and stir in salt, pepper, and cooked chicken.  Cook for 5 minutes until heated through.

scenes.image_prompt: The chicken mixture being poured into a casserole dish, then topped with a pie crust. Show the process of crimping the edges and cutting slits in the top crust.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the mixture into a casserole dish. Top with pie crusts, crimp the edges, and cut slits for ventilation.

scenes.image_prompt: Time-lapse of the chicken pot pie baking in the oven, the crust turning golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Bake for 40-50 minutes, until golden brown and bubbly. Let cool for 10-15 minutes before serving.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a slice of the finished chicken pot pie being served, with a side salad in the background.
scenes.voice_over: Serve and enjoy your delicious homemade chicken pot pie! It's great with a side salad.  Each serving has approximately 400 calories, 25g of protein, 30g of carbs, and 20g of fat.

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use rotisserie chicken.
Add a pinch of dried thyme or rosemary to the filling for extra herb flavor.
If you don't have half-and-half, you can substitute with milk or heavy cream.
Blind bake the pie crust for a crispier bottom crust.

recipes.name: Easy Beef or Chicken Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 lb Ground beef or 1 lb Boneless, skinless chicken breasts
1 teaspoon Garlic powder (or 1 clove minced fresh garlic)
3 cups Shredded Monterey Jack or cheddar cheese blend
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).

Step 2: Prepare the meat: If using chicken, boil until cooked through. Shred with two forks. If using ground beef, brown in a skillet over medium heat until cooked through. Drain off any excess grease.
Step 3: In the skillet with the cooked meat, add the chopped onion and garlic (powder or minced). Cook until the onion is softened, about 5 minutes.
Step 4: To the meat mixture, add the Worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce, paprika, oregano, chili powder, cumin, and black pepper. Stir to combine and simmer for 10 minutes.
Step 5: Heat the oil in a separate skillet over medium heat.  Quickly fry each tortilla for about 10 seconds per side, just until softened. Drain on paper towels.
Step 6: Lightly coat the bottom of a 10x13 inch baking dish with enchilada sauce.
Step 7: Fill each tortilla with about 1/4 cup of the meat mixture. Add cheese and optional olives to each tortilla.
Step 8: Roll up each filled tortilla and place seam-down in the prepared baking dish.
Step 9: Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the enchiladas and top with the remaining shredded cheese.  Add additional olives, if desired.
Step 10: Bake for 20 minutes, or until heated through and the cheese is melted and bubbly. If refrigerated, bake for 30 minutes.
Step 11: Top with sour cream and serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of easy beef enchiladas, oozing cheese and sauce, nestled in a vibrant, hand-painted ceramic baking dish.  Use soft, natural lighting to highlight the texture of the melted cheese and the rich color of the sauce.  Garnish with freshly chopped cilantro and a dollop of sour cream.  A shallow depth of field focuses on the enchiladas in the foreground, blurring the colorful woven placemat and rustic wooden table in the background.  The mood is warm, inviting, and comforting.

video_script.title: Easy Beef or Chicken Enchiladas
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious and easy beef or chicken enchiladas with this simple recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished baking dish of enchiladas, bubbly cheese, garnished with sour cream and black olives. Steam rising, warm lighting.
scenes.voice_over: Craving cheesy, flavorful enchiladas? This recipe is quick, easy, and customizable with your protein of choice, beef or chicken!

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients laid out on a wooden table: Ground beef/chicken breasts, onion, garlic, spices (paprika, oregano, chili powder, cumin, black pepper), Worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Let's gather our ingredients.  You'll need ground beef or chicken, onion, garlic, some pantry spices, Worcestershire and tomato sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: A skillet browning ground beef or shredded chicken.  Focus on the meat and the browning process.
scenes.voice_over: First, brown your ground beef until cooked through, or if using chicken, boil it until cooked through and shred it with two forks. Drain any excess grease from the beef.

scenes.image_prompt: The skillet with meat, sauteed onions, and garlic.
scenes.voice_over: Add chopped onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: The skillet with the meat mixture simmering, spices being stirred in.
scenes.voice_over: Now, stir in Worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce, paprika, oregano, chili powder, cumin, and black pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes to let the flavors meld.

scenes.image_prompt: Corn tortillas being quickly fried in a skillet with oil.
scenes.voice_over: In a separate skillet, heat some oil and quickly fry each tortilla for about 10 seconds per side, just to soften them. Drain on paper towels.

scenes.image_prompt: A tortilla being filled with meat, cheese and olives.
scenes.voice_over: Lightly coat a baking dish with enchilada sauce. Fill each tortilla with the meat mixture, cheese, and optional olives. Roll them up and place them seam-down in the dish.

scenes.image_prompt: Enchiladas in the baking dish being covered with enchilada sauce and cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the enchiladas and top with the remaining cheese. Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes, or until heated through and bubbly. If refrigerated, bake for 30 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Finished enchiladas on a plate, garnished with sour cream, a side of Spanish rice and guacamole.
scenes.voice_over: Top with sour cream and serve immediately! These enchiladas are delicious with sides of Spanish rice, guacamole, or a simple salad.  Each serving has approximately 350 calories, 25 grams of protein, 30 grams of carbs, and 15 grams of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a spicier dish, use a hotter chili powder or add a pinch of cayenne pepper.
If you don't have time to soften the tortillas, you can wrap the stack in a damp paper towel and microwave for 1 minute.
Leftovers can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Whole Roasted Chicken
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine salt, paprika, cayenne pepper, onion powder, thyme, white pepper, garlic powder, and black pepper.
Step 2: Remove giblets and neck from the chicken cavity. Rinse the chicken thoroughly and pat dry.
Step 3: Rub the spice mixture all over the chicken, ensuring it's evenly coated.
Step 4: Place the seasoned chicken in a resealable plastic bag and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight.
Step 5: If using, place chopped onion in the bottom of the slow cooker.
Step 6: Place the chicken on top of the onions in the slow cooker.
Step 7: Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C) in the thickest part of the thigh.
Step 8: Let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a slow cooker whole roasted chicken, glistening with a spice rub of paprika, cayenne, and herbs. Position the chicken on a rustic wooden board, surrounded by scattered onions and sprigs of fresh thyme. Use warm, natural lighting to highlight the crispy skin and juicy meat.  Focus on the breast, with a shallow depth of field blurring the background. Create a cozy, inviting mood with a dark, slightly textured backdrop. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle, showcasing the entire chicken and its accompaniments.

video_script.title: Slow Cooker Whole Roasted Chicken
video_script.description: Learn how to make a flavorful and juicy whole roasted chicken in your slow cooker. This easy recipe is perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a beautifully roasted whole chicken in a slow cooker, surrounded by roasted vegetables. Steam is gently rising, and the chicken skin is golden brown and crispy.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a delicious and easy slow cooker whole roasted chicken. This recipe is perfect for a weeknight meal or a special occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: whole chicken, spices, onion.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: a whole roasting chicken, salt, paprika, cayenne pepper, onion powder, dried thyme, white pepper, garlic powder, black pepper, and one cup of chopped yellow onion, which is optional.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hands measuring and combining spices in a small bowl.
scenes.voice_over: First, combine the salt, paprika, cayenne, onion powder, thyme, white pepper, garlic powder, and black pepper in a small bowl. This blend will give our chicken a delicious flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hands rinsing and patting dry a whole chicken. Giblets and neck are removed and set aside.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the giblets and neck from the chicken cavity. Rinse the chicken thoroughly and pat it dry with paper towels.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hands rubbing the spice mixture all over the chicken.
scenes.voice_over: Rub the spice mixture all over the chicken, making sure it's evenly coated.  Don't be shy with the spices!

scenes.image_prompt: The seasoned chicken placed in a resealable bag.
scenes.voice_over: Place the seasoned chicken in a resealable bag and refrigerate for at least two hours, or preferably overnight. This allows the flavors to meld.

scenes.image_prompt: Chopped onions being placed in the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: If using, place the chopped onion in the bottom of your slow cooker.

scenes.image_prompt: The seasoned chicken placed on top of the onions in the slow cooker. The slow cooker lid is placed on top.
scenes.voice_over: Place the chicken on top of the onions in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C) in the thickest part of the thigh.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the chicken thigh, reading 165°F.
scenes.voice_over: Use a meat thermometer to ensure the chicken is cooked through. It should register 165°F (74°C).

scenes.image_prompt: The cooked chicken resting on a cutting board, tented with foil.
scenes.voice_over: Let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving. This allows the juices to redistribute, making the chicken more tender.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of sliced roasted chicken served on a plate, garnished with fresh herbs.  Mashed potatoes and roasted vegetables are served alongside.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious slow cooker whole roasted chicken with your favorite sides. Mashed potatoes and roasted vegetables are great choices. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: A pop-up timer inserted into the chicken is a helpful way to ensure it's cooked through.
If your slow cooker tends to cook hot, reduce the cooking time to prevent the chicken from drying out.
The cooked chicken can be shredded and used in salads, sandwiches, or tacos.

recipes.name: Baked Ham with Brown Sugar-Mustard Glaze
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 2: In a medium-sized bowl, combine the brown sugar and yellow mustard, mixing until a thick paste forms.
Step 3: Remove all packaging from the ham and trim away any excess fat.
Step 4: Line a large baking pan with aluminum foil. Lightly grease the foil with cooking spray to prevent sticking.
Step 5: Place the ham on the prepared foil and spread the brown sugar-mustard paste evenly over the entire surface.
Step 6: Fold the foil over the ham, sealing it tightly to create a closed packet.
Step 7: Bake for 4 hours.
Step 8: Remove the ham from the oven and let it rest, still sealed in foil, for 1 hour.
Step 9: Carefully unwrap the ham and carve. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Creamy Artichoke and Chicken Bake
ingredients: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Lightly grease an 11x7 inch baking dish.
3. Season the chicken breast halves with salt and pepper and place them in the prepared baking dish.
4. In a medium bowl, combine the chopped artichoke hearts, Parmesan cheese, mayonnaise, and garlic powder. Mix well.
5. Spread the artichoke mixture evenly over the chicken breasts.
6. Bake, uncovered, for 30-35 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear.

recipes.name: Quick & Easy Vietnamese Chicken Noodle Soup
ingredients: 8 ounces boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
directions: Step 1: Place cellophane noodles in a bowl and cover with very hot tap water. Let soak until softened.
Step 2: While the noodles are soaking, thinly slice the chicken breasts into julienne strips.
Step 3: Heat peanut oil in a large pot or deep skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 4: Add the sliced chicken, minced garlic, minced ginger, and red pepper flakes to the pot. Cook and stir for 1 minute.
Step 5: Pour in the chicken broth and fish sauce. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Step 6: Reduce the heat to medium and simmer until the chicken is cooked through, about 8 minutes.
Step 7: Drain the softened cellophane noodles and cut them into shorter pieces, about 1-1 1/2 inches long.
Step 8: Divide the noodles among serving bowls. Ladle the hot soup over the noodles.
Step 9: Garnish each bowl with chopped cilantro, green onions, and basil.
Step 10: Serve hot with sriracha or chili paste, if desired.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a steaming bowl of Quick & Easy Vietnamese Chicken Noodle Soup against a dark, rustic wooden backdrop.  Focus sharply on the glistening chicken and translucent noodles, using a shallow depth of field to soften the cilantro and green onion garnishes.  Employ warm, directional lighting to highlight the broth's rich color and the texture of the ingredients. Incorporate chopsticks and a ceramic spoon as props.  Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the inviting aroma and vibrant colors for a comforting, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Baja Black Bean, Corn, and Rice Bowl
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Step 1: Prepare the rice: Cook the brown rice according to package directions.
Step 2: Combine the ingredients: In a medium bowl, combine the black beans, corn, diced tomatoes, red onion, cilantro, jalapeño, lime juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, and hot sauce.
Step 3: Assemble the bowls: Place a scoop of hot cooked rice in a bowl or on a plate. Top with a generous scoop of the black bean and corn mixture.
Step 4: Serve: Stir the rice and black bean mixture together before eating.

scenes.voice_over: First, rinse and drain the black beans and corn. This removes excess starch and sodium.

scenes.image_prompt: A knife dicing tomatoes, chopping red onion, cilantro, and mincing jalapeño on a cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: Next, dice the tomatoes, finely chop the red onion and cilantro, and mince the jalapeño. Remove the jalapeño seeds for less heat.

scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, combine the black beans, corn, tomatoes, red onion, cilantro, jalapeño. Then, add the lime juice, olive oil, salt, pepper, and hot sauce. Mix everything together.

If you don't have fresh lime juice, you can substitute bottled lime juice.
This recipe is a great way to use up leftover cooked rice.
To make this dish ahead of time, prepare the black bean and corn mixture and store it separately from the rice. Combine just before serving.

recipes.name: Caramelized Chicken Wings
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Place chicken wings in a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Step 3: In a separate bowl, whisk together the olive oil, soy sauce, ketchup, honey, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Step 4: Pour the sauce over the chicken wings, ensuring they are evenly coated.
Step 5: Bake for 60 minutes, or until the sauce is caramelized and the chicken is cooked through. Check the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F (74°C).
recipes.image_prompt: Capture caramelized chicken wings glistening with a honey-soy glaze, arranged artfully on a rustic wooden board. Utilize a shallow depth of field, focusing on the front wings, highlighting their crispy texture. Soft, directional lighting should emphasize the deep amber color and sticky glaze. Incorporate fresh cilantro sprigs as garnish and a small bowl of dipping sauce in the background. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the wings' plumpness and caramelization. Aim for a warm, inviting mood, suggestive of a comforting and delicious meal.

video_script.title: Caramelized Chicken Wings
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious, sticky caramelized chicken wings at home with this easy recipe.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of glistening, caramelized chicken wings arranged on a serving platter, garnished with chopped green onions.
scenes.voice_over: Craving sweet and savory chicken wings? Look no further! Today, we're making irresistible caramelized chicken wings that are perfect for any occasion.

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: 3 pounds of chicken wings, olive oil, soy sauce, ketchup, honey, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.

scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Place the chicken wings in a 9x13-inch baking dish.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of whisking together olive oil, soy sauce, ketchup, honey, minced garlic, salt, and pepper in a glass bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a separate bowl, whisk together 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1/2 cup of soy sauce, 2 tablespoons of ketchup, 1 cup of honey, 1 minced clove of garlic, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of pepper.

scenes.image_prompt: Pouring the sauce over the chicken wings in the baking dish, ensuring they are evenly coated.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the sauce over the chicken wings, making sure they are evenly coated. This will ensure maximum flavor and caramelization.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken wings baking in the oven, sauce bubbling and caramelizing.
scenes.voice_over: Bake for 60 minutes, or until the sauce is caramelized and the chicken is cooked through. The internal temperature should reach 165°F (74°C).

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished caramelized chicken wings, glistening and sticky, being removed from the oven.
scenes.voice_over: Once baked, remove the wings from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished caramelized chicken wings on a serving platter, garnished with chopped green onions, served with dipping sauces like ranch or blue cheese dressing and sides such as celery sticks and carrot sticks.
scenes.voice_over: These caramelized chicken wings are delicious on their own or served with your favorite dipping sauces and sides. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy wings, pat them dry with paper towels before marinating.
If the sauce caramelizes too quickly, cover the dish with foil for a portion of the cooking time.
Baste the wings with the sauce every 20 minutes to ensure even coating and caramelization.

recipes.name: Classic Beef Stroganoff
ingredients: 2 (4 ounce) cans mushroom stems and pieces, drained
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
directions: Step 1: Cook the egg noodles according to package directions and set aside.
Step 2: In a large skillet or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Step 3: Add the ground beef to the skillet and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until browned. Drain off any excess grease.
Step 4: Sprinkle the flour over the beef and stir to combine. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Step 5: Add the drained mushrooms, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
Step 6: Pour in the condensed cream of mushroom soup and stir until smooth. Bring the mixture to a simmer.
Step 7: Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes, or until the flavors have melded.
Step 8: Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the sour cream until heated through. Do not boil.
Step 9: Serve the beef stroganoff hot over the cooked egg noodles.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a rich and creamy Beef Stroganoff, garnished with fresh parsley, over a bed of golden egg noodles. Use a dark wood background and linen napkin for contrast.  Shoot from a slightly overhead angle with a shallow depth of field, focusing on the glistening sauce and tender beef. Soft, diffused lighting should highlight the textures and create a warm, inviting mood.  Include a rustic fork partially submerged in the dish, suggesting a freshly served meal.

video_script.title: Classic Beef Stroganoff Recipe
video_script.description: Learn how to make creamy, comforting Beef Stroganoff from scratch with this easy-to-follow video tutorial. This classic dish is perfect for a weeknight meal or a special occasion.

scenes.voice_over: In a large skillet or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Ground beef browning in the skillet with onions and garlic. A wooden spoon is breaking up the beef.
scenes.voice_over: Add the ground beef to the skillet and cook, breaking it up with a spoon, until browned. Drain off any excess grease.

scenes.image_prompt: Flour being sprinkled over the browned ground beef, followed by stirring with a wooden spoon.
scenes.voice_over: Sprinkle the flour over the beef and stir constantly for about 1 minute.

scenes.image_prompt: Mushrooms, salt, and pepper being added to the skillet with the beef mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add the drained mushrooms, salt, and pepper. Stir well.

scenes.image_prompt: Cream of mushroom soup being poured into the skillet. The mixture is stirred until smooth.
scenes.voice_over: Pour in the cream of mushroom soup and stir until everything is well combined. Bring the mixture to a simmer.

scenes.image_prompt: The beef stroganoff simmering in the skillet, covered with a lid.
scenes.voice_over: Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes to let the flavors meld.

scenes.image_prompt: Sour cream being stirred into the beef stroganoff after it's removed from the heat.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the skillet from the heat and gently stir in the sour cream until heated through. Be careful not to boil.

scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious Beef Stroganoff hot over the cooked egg noodles. Garnish with fresh parsley.  This dish pairs well with a side salad and crusty bread. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use beef broth instead of water when cooking the noodles.
If you prefer a thicker sauce, you can add a cornstarch slurry (1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons cold water) to the stroganoff during the last few minutes of cooking.
Garnish with fresh parsley or chives before serving.

recipes.name: Easy Crock-Pot Moroccan Chicken, Chickpea, and Apricot Tagine
ingredients: 3 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts or assorted chicken pieces, cut into large chunks
1 tbsp all-purpose flour or 2 tbsp cornstarch
2 (14 oz) cans chickpeas, drained and rinsed
4 tsp ras el hanout spice blend
Salt and black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1: In a large skillet or frying pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the chopped onions and minced garlic for 5-10 minutes, until softened.
Step 2: In a small bowl, whisk together the chicken stock and flour or cornstarch until smooth.
Step 3: Add the honey and tomato paste to the skillet with the onions and garlic. Stir well to combine.
Step 4: Add the spices (ras el hanout, coriander, cinnamon, cumin, cayenne if using), ginger, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Mix well.
Step 5: Add the canned tomatoes and stir to combine.
Step 6: Pour the tomato, onion, and spice mixture into the slow cooker.
Step 7: Add the chicken, chickpeas, and dried apricots to the slow cooker. Ensure the apricots are submerged in the liquid.
Step 8: If using, add the diced carrots and preserved lemon.
Step 9: Stir gently to combine all ingredients.
Step 10: Cook on high for 3-4 hours, or on low for 6-8 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Step 11: If the sauce needs thickening, mix a small amount of cornstarch with water to form a slurry and add it to the tagine towards the end of cooking time. Stir well.
Step 12: Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro. Accompany with couscous, rice, flatbread, pita bread, or salad.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of Easy Crock-Pot Moroccan Chicken, Chickpea, and Apricot Tagine in a rustic, earthenware tagine or shallow bowl.  Focus on the glistening chicken and vibrant apricots against the rich sauce. Use warm, directional light to enhance textures and create depth.  Incorporate a shallow depth of field, focusing on the chicken, with softly blurred chickpeas and apricots in the foreground.  Garnish with fresh cilantro and toasted slivered almonds.  Style with a textured linen napkin and warm-toned backdrop, evoking a cozy, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Easy Crock-Pot Moroccan Chicken, Chickpea, and Apricot Tagine
video_script.description: A flavorful and easy-to-make Moroccan tagine recipe using a slow cooker.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished Moroccan chicken tagine in a slow cooker, garnished with fresh cilantro. Steam rises from the tagine, highlighting the vibrant colors of the dish and the tender chicken pieces.
scenes.voice_over: Craving a warm and flavorful meal? Today, we're making a delicious and easy Moroccan Chicken, Chickpea, and Apricot Tagine using your crock-pot!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a table: chicken pieces, onions, garlic, ginger, dried apricots, canned tomatoes, chickpeas, spices, honey, chicken stock, and olive oil.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: chicken, onions, garlic, ginger, dried apricots, canned tomatoes, chickpeas, honey, chicken stock, olive oil, and a blend of Moroccan spices including ras el hanout, coriander, cinnamon, cumin, and a pinch of cayenne for a kick.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a skillet with onions and garlic sautéing in olive oil.
scenes.voice_over: Start by sautéing chopped onions and minced garlic in olive oil until softened, about 5-10 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Show whisking together chicken stock and flour in a small bowl until smooth.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, whisk together chicken stock and flour or cornstarch to create a thickening agent for our tagine.

scenes.image_prompt: Show adding spices, honey, and tomato paste to the skillet with the onions and garlic, stirring to combine.
scenes.voice_over: Add honey and tomato paste to the skillet, followed by our fragrant spices: ras el hanout, coriander, cinnamon, cumin, and cayenne pepper if you like it spicy.

scenes.image_prompt: Show adding the canned tomatoes to the skillet and stirring to combine.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add the canned tomatoes and stir to combine, creating a rich base for our tagine.

scenes.image_prompt: Show transferring the tomato, onion, and spice mixture to the slow cooker.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the mixture from the skillet into your slow cooker.

scenes.image_prompt: Show adding chicken, chickpeas, and dried apricots to the slow cooker, ensuring apricots are submerged.
scenes.voice_over: Add the chicken, chickpeas, and dried apricots. Make sure those apricots are submerged to ensure they soften beautifully.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the slow cooker lid on and the slow cooker set to low.
scenes.voice_over: Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours, or on high for 3-4 hours. The chicken should be cooked through and tender.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the finished tagine in the slow cooker, garnished with cilantro, with a spoon stirring in a cornstarch slurry.
scenes.voice_over: If you prefer a thicker sauce, mix a little cornstarch with water and stir it into the tagine towards the end of cooking.

scenes.image_prompt: Show a serving of the Moroccan tagine over couscous, garnished with cilantro, with a side of pita bread.
scenes.voice_over: Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro. Enjoy with couscous, rice, or flatbread!

cooking_tips: If using dried chickpeas, soak and cook them before adding to the slow cooker.
Adjust the amount of cayenne pepper to control the level of heat.
Preserved lemons add a unique, tangy flavor to the dish.
Serve with couscous, rice, or flatbread for a complete meal.

recipes.name: Baked Pork Chops with Creamy Mushroom Sauce
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 2: Rinse pork chops and pat dry. Season both sides with garlic powder and seasoning salt.
Step 3: Place beaten eggs in a shallow dish. In another shallow dish, place flour. In a third shallow dish, place breadcrumbs.
Step 4: Dredge each pork chop in flour, then dip in the beaten egg, and finally coat thoroughly with breadcrumbs.
Step 5: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry pork chops for about 5 minutes per side, until golden brown.
Step 6: Transfer pork chops to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Step 7: In a medium bowl, whisk together cream of mushroom soup, milk, and white wine.
Step 8: Pour the soup mixture over the pork chops in the baking dish.
Step 9: Cover the baking dish tightly with foil and bake for 1 hour.
Step 10: Remove foil and bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until the pork chops are cooked through and the sauce is bubbly.
Step 11: Let rest for 5-10 minutes before serving.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture six golden-brown, baked pork chops drizzled with creamy mushroom sauce, arranged slightly overlapping on a rustic wooden serving board.  Focus on the foreground chop, highlighting the crispy breading and sauce texture.  Use soft, natural light from the side to create gentle shadows. Incorporate fresh parsley sprigs as garnish and a linen napkin draped casually in the background.  Shallow depth of field, emphasizing the textures and rich colors. Aim for a warm, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Baked Pork Chops with Creamy Mushroom Sauce
video_script.description: Learn how to make juicy, tender baked pork chops smothered in a rich and flavorful creamy mushroom sauce. This easy recipe is perfect for a weeknight dinner or a special occasion.

scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making baked pork chops with a creamy mushroom sauce. This recipe is easy to follow and delivers a delicious, comforting meal.

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: six boneless pork chops, garlic powder, seasoning salt, eggs, flour, and Italian breadcrumbs for the breading.  For the sauce, we'll use cream of mushroom soup, milk, and dry white wine. And of course, some olive oil for pan-frying.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork chops being seasoned with garlic powder and seasoning salt.
scenes.voice_over: First, rinse and pat dry the pork chops. Season both sides generously with garlic powder and seasoning salt.

scenes.image_prompt: A pork chop being dredged in flour, then dipped in egg, and finally coated in breadcrumbs.
scenes.voice_over: Prepare your breading station: flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs. Dredge each pork chop in flour, then dip in the egg, ensuring it's fully coated, and finally coat thoroughly with breadcrumbs.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork chops being pan-fried in olive oil until golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the pork chops for about 5 minutes per side, until golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: Cream of mushroom soup, milk, and white wine being whisked together in a bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, whisk together the cream of mushroom soup, milk, and white wine until smooth.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork chops arranged in a baking dish, then the creamy mushroom sauce being poured over them.
scenes.voice_over: Transfer the pork chops to a baking dish. Pour the creamy mushroom sauce over the pork chops, ensuring they are evenly coated.

scenes.image_prompt: The baking dish covered with foil being placed in a preheated oven.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Cover the baking dish tightly with foil and bake for 1 hour.

scenes.image_prompt: The baking dish, uncovered, showing bubbly sauce and cooked pork chops.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the foil and bake for another 30 minutes, or until the pork chops are cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.

scenes.voice_over: Let the pork chops rest for 5-10 minutes before serving. These delicious baked pork chops are perfect with mashed potatoes, steamed green beans, or your favorite sides. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For crispier breading, use panko breadcrumbs.
If you don't have white wine, you can substitute with chicken broth or additional milk.
To prevent the sauce from becoming too thick, add a little extra milk or water during baking if needed.

recipes.name: Chicken Cordon Bleu Casserole
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch cubes
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 2: In a shallow dish, whisk together 1/2 cup milk and the egg.
Step 3: Dip each chicken cube into the milk-egg mixture, then dredge in breadcrumbs, ensuring it's fully coated.
Step 4: Heat a large skillet over medium heat with a tablespoon of oil. Brown the chicken cubes until golden, about 2-3 minutes per side. Do not fully cook the chicken at this stage.
Step 5: In a 9x13 inch baking dish, arrange the browned chicken cubes.
Step 6: Sprinkle the cubed Swiss cheese and diced ham evenly over the chicken.
Step 7: In a medium bowl, whisk together the cream of chicken soup and 1 cup of milk until smooth.
Step 8: Pour the soup mixture over the chicken, cheese, and ham.
Step 9: Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the casserole is bubbly and the chicken is cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of Chicken Cordon Bleu Casserole in a white, oven-safe dish, fresh from the oven. Golden-brown breadcrumbs should be the focal point, with a shallow depth of field highlighting the bubbly, cheesy center.  Use soft, natural light to showcase the creamy texture and warm tones. Garnish with fresh parsley sprigs. A rustic wooden background and a linen napkin enhance the inviting, comforting mood. Include a serving spoon partially submerged, implying a just-served portion.

video_script.title: Chicken Cordon Bleu Casserole - Easy Weeknight Dinner

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: chicken breasts, breadcrumbs, milk, an egg, Swiss cheese, ham, and cream of chicken soup.

scenes.voice_over: Whisk together milk and egg. Dip each chicken cube in the mixture and coat thoroughly with breadcrumbs.

scenes.voice_over: Brown the chicken in a skillet for 2-3 minutes per side. No need to fully cook it through.

scenes.voice_over: Place the browned chicken in your baking dish. Sprinkle with Swiss cheese and ham.

scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, whisk together cream of chicken soup and milk until smooth.

scenes.voice_over: Pour the soup mixture over the chicken, cheese, and ham. Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 30-35 minutes, or until bubbly and the chicken reaches 165°F (74°C).

scenes.voice_over: This Chicken Cordon Bleu Casserole is a complete meal on its own, or serve with a side salad and bread. Each serving has approximately 400 calories, 30g of protein, 25g of carbs, and 20g of fat.

cooking_tips: For a crispier topping, mix some melted butter with the breadcrumbs before coating the chicken.
Use low-sodium soup and ham to reduce overall sodium content.

recipes.name: Big Thicket Chicken and Dumplings
directions: 1. Place the whole chicken and water in a large stockpot or Dutch oven. Add 1 teaspoon of poultry seasoning, garlic powder, and black pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and cook for about 1 hour, or until the chicken is tender.
2. Carefully remove the chicken from the pot and set aside to cool. Remove 2 cups of stock and set aside to cool.
3. Add the chopped celery, sliced green onions, shredded carrot, and bouillon cubes to the remaining stock in the pot. Simmer over low heat.
4. While the chicken and stock are cooling, prepare the dumplings. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, 1 teaspoon of poultry seasoning, and salt.
5. Add the margarine or shortening and mix until the mixture is coarse and crumbly. A hand mixer can be helpful for this step.
6. Add the beaten eggs and cooled chicken stock (make sure the stock is just barely warm) to the dry ingredients. Stir by hand until a dough forms.
7. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead briefly until smooth. If the dough is too large to manage, divide it in half and roll out one portion at a time.
8. Roll out the dough to approximately 1/8-inch thickness.
9. Using a sharp knife or pizza cutter, cut the dough into 1-inch wide strips vertically. Repeat the process horizontally to create small square dumplings.
10. Bring the chicken stock back to a boil. Drop the dumplings in a few at a time, working quickly.
11. Cook the dumplings for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent them from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
12. Remove the pot from the heat and cover.
13. Once the chicken is cool enough to handle, remove the skin and bones. Shred or chop the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
14. Add the cooked chicken to the pot with the dumplings and broth. Stir gently to combine.
15. Serve hot.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a steaming bowl of Big Thicket Chicken and Dumplings, nestled amongst rustic wooden serving bowls and antique silverware on a dark, textured tabletop.  Use soft, diffused natural light from the side to highlight the fluffy dumplings and tender chicken.  Garnish with fresh chopped parsley and a sprinkle of black pepper. Focus on the dumplings in the foreground with a shallow depth of field, creating a blurred background.  The overall mood should be warm, comforting, and inviting.  Shoot from a slightly overhead angle to showcase the texture and abundance of the dish.

video_script.title: Big Thicket Chicken and Dumplings
video_script.description: A comforting Southern classic, perfect for a chilly evening.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a steaming bowl of Big Thicket Chicken and Dumplings, garnished with fresh parsley. Focus on the fluffy dumplings and tender chicken in the rich broth.
scenes.voice_over: Warm up with a bowl of hearty, comforting Big Thicket Chicken and Dumplings! This Southern classic is packed with flavor and perfect for a chilly evening.

scenes.voice_over: For this recipe, you'll need a whole chicken, celery, carrots, green onions, and a blend of spices including poultry seasoning, garlic powder, black pepper, and optionally, a pinch of red pepper flakes.

scenes.voice_over: Place the whole chicken in a large pot, cover with water, and season with poultry seasoning, garlic powder, and black pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about an hour, or until the chicken is tender.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken being removed from the pot with tongs and set aside on a plate to cool. Two cups of stock are being carefully measured and poured into a separate bowl.
scenes.voice_over: Carefully remove the cooked chicken and set it aside to cool. Reserve two cups of the cooking stock and let it cool slightly. We'll use this later for the dumplings.

scenes.image_prompt: Chopped celery, green onions, shredded carrots, and chicken bouillon cubes being added to the remaining stock in the pot.
scenes.voice_over: Add the chopped celery, sliced green onions, shredded carrot, and chicken bouillon cubes to the remaining stock. Simmer over low heat to allow the flavors to meld.

scenes.image_prompt: Close up of hands combining flour, baking powder, poultry seasoning, salt, margarine, and eggs in a large mixing bowl.
scenes.voice_over: While the chicken and stock cool, prepare the dumplings. Combine flour, baking powder, poultry seasoning, salt, margarine or shortening, and eggs. Gradually add the cooled chicken stock and mix until a dough forms.

scenes.image_prompt: Rolling out dumpling dough on a floured surface and cutting into small squares.
scenes.voice_over: Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and roll it out to about 1/8-inch thickness. Cut the dough into small squares using a knife or pizza cutter.

scenes.voice_over: Bring the chicken stock back to a boil. Drop the dumplings in a few at a time and cook for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

scenes.image_prompt: Shredded chicken being added to the pot with the cooked dumplings and broth.
scenes.voice_over: Shred the cooled chicken and add it to the pot with the dumplings and broth. Stir gently to combine.

scenes.voice_over: Serve your Big Thicket Chicken and Dumplings hot, garnished with fresh parsley. A side of crusty bread is the perfect complement to this comforting dish. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For richer flavor, use homemade chicken stock.
If the dumpling dough is too sticky, add a little more flour.
Don't overcook the dumplings, or they will become mushy.
Leftovers can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or frozen for longer storage.

recipes.name: Beth's Homemade Pizza Crust
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the yeast and warm water. Stir until the yeast is dissolved.
Step 2: Add the flour, olive oil, sugar (if using), and salt to the yeast mixture. Mix well until a dough forms.
Step 3: Let the dough rest for 5 minutes.
Step 4: On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired size and shape.
Step 5: Place the rolled-out dough on a baking sheet or pizza stone.
Step 6: Preheat oven to 450°F (232°C).
Step 7: Bake for 15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture Beth's Homemade Pizza Crust, golden brown and inviting.  Focus on the airy texture and slightly charred edges. Use a slightly overhead, angled shot with a shallow depth of field, highlighting the crust's texture. Include simple, rustic props like a wooden peel and a linen napkin dusted with flour. Soft, natural light should create a warm and inviting mood. Garnish with a sprinkle of Italian seasoning and a drizzle of olive oil for visual appeal.  The background should be subtly textured and neutral, allowing the crust to be the star.

video_script.title: Beth's Homemade Pizza Crust
video_script.description: Learn how to make Beth's delicious homemade pizza crust! This easy recipe is perfect for beginners and yields a crispy, golden crust every time.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished pizza with golden-brown, crispy crust, topped with vibrant tomato sauce, melted mozzarella cheese, and fresh basil. Focus on the texture of the crust.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome to my kitchen! Today, we're making Beth's Homemade Pizza Crust, a simple recipe that results in a fantastic base for any pizza.  Get ready for a crispy, golden crust that's easy to make!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden countertop: yeast packet, warm water in a glass measuring cup, all-purpose flour, olive oil in a small bowl, sugar, salt, and Italian seasoning.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: active dry yeast, warm water, all-purpose flour, olive oil, some sugar if you like, salt, and optionally, Italian seasoning.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a large bowl with yeast dissolving in warm water.  Steam gently rising from the bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, combine the yeast and warm water. Stir gently until the yeast dissolves and starts to foam slightly. This activates the yeast and helps create a light and airy crust.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of adding flour, olive oil, sugar, and salt to the yeast mixture. Show a hand gradually incorporating the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.
scenes.voice_over: Add the flour, olive oil, sugar (if using), and salt to the yeast mixture.  Mix everything together until a dough starts to form.

scenes.image_prompt: A bowl covered with a clean kitchen towel. Timer set for 5 minutes visible beside the bowl.
scenes.voice_over: Let the dough rest for 5 minutes. This allows the gluten to relax, making it easier to roll out.

scenes.image_prompt: Hands kneading and rolling the dough on a lightly floured surface. Show the dough transforming from a rough ball to a smooth, flat circle.
scenes.voice_over: On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired size and thickness. This recipe makes enough for one large pizza or two smaller ones.

scenes.image_prompt: Rolled-out pizza dough on a baking sheet or pizza stone. An oven in the background preheating.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 450°F (232°C). Once preheated, carefully transfer the rolled-out dough to a baking sheet or pizza stone.

scenes.image_prompt: Pizza crust baking in the oven.  The crust beginning to turn golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Bake for approximately 15 minutes, or until the crust turns a beautiful golden brown and feels firm to the touch.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished pizza crust, golden brown and slightly puffed up.  Steam rising from the crust.
scenes.voice_over: And there you have it! A perfectly baked pizza crust ready for your favorite toppings.

scenes.image_prompt: Final shot of a pizza with toppings, cut into slices on a serving platter with a pizza cutter beside it. Garnish with fresh basil.
scenes.voice_over: Once cooled slightly, add your favorite toppings and bake again until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Enjoy Beth's Homemade Pizza Crust with friends and family!

cooking_tips: If omitting sugar, add a few shakes of Italian seasoning for extra flavor.
This dough can be used for various pizza sizes, from a standard round to a jelly roll pan.

recipes.name: Black Bean and Couscous Salad
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
directions: Step 1: Bring the chicken broth to a boil in a 2-quart or larger saucepan.
Step 2: Stir in the couscous, cover the pot, remove from heat, and let stand for 5 minutes.
Step 3: In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lime juice, red wine vinegar, and cumin.
Step 4: Add the chopped green onions, chopped red bell pepper, chopped cilantro, thawed corn kernels, and drained black beans to the bowl. Toss to coat.
Step 5: Fluff the couscous with a fork, breaking up any chunks.
Step 6: Add the fluffed couscous to the bowl with the vegetables and mix well.
Step 7: Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 8: Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Black Bean and Couscous Salad in a shallow, rustic bowl against a light, textured backdrop.  Use soft, natural light to highlight the colorful ingredients. Focus on the glistening corn and chopped bell pepper, with a shallow depth of field blurring the cilantro garnish.  Incorporate a linen napkin and wooden serving spoon as props. video_script.title: Black Bean and Couscous Salad: Quick, Healthy & Delicious!
video_script.description: Learn how to make this vibrant and flavorful Black Bean and Couscous Salad. It's packed with protein, fiber, and fresh ingredients, perfect for a light lunch, dinner, or potluck.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished Black Bean and Couscous Salad, garnished with fresh cilantro. The salad is in a white bowl, and the background is slightly blurred.

scenes.voice_over: While the couscous rests, whisk together olive oil, lime juice, red wine vinegar, and cumin in a large bowl to make the dressing.

recipes.name: Chicken Pesto with Provolone and Mushrooms
ingredients: 1 (0.7 ounce) package dry pesto sauce mix
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 2: Lightly grease a 9x12 inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray.
Step 3: Prepare pesto sauce according to package directions.
Step 4: Moisten chicken breasts with water and then dredge in breadcrumbs, ensuring they are fully coated.
Step 5: Place breaded chicken breasts in the prepared baking dish.
Step 6: Spread prepared pesto sauce evenly over each chicken breast.
Step 7: Top each chicken breast with half a slice of provolone cheese.
Step 8: Distribute sliced mushrooms evenly over the cheese.
Step 9: Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.
Step 10: Serve hot with your favorite pasta.

scenes.text: Chicken Pesto with Provolone and Mushrooms
scenes.voice_over: Craving a flavorful and satisfying meal? Look no further! Today, we're making Chicken Pesto with Provolone and Mushrooms. This recipe is simple, quick, and delivers a burst of flavor in every bite.

scenes.image_prompt: Show a bowl with pesto sauce being prepared according to package directions.
scenes.voice_over: First, prepare the pesto sauce according to the package directions.  Usually, this involves mixing the pesto powder with water and oil. Set this aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Show chicken breasts being dipped in water and then dredged in breadcrumbs.

recipes.name: Black Bean and Tortilla Casserole
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
8 ounces low-fat cheddar cheese, shredded (reserve 2 tablespoons)
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Lightly grease a large skillet with cooking spray.
3. Add minced garlic, chopped yellow onion, chopped tomato, chopped green onion, chili powder, and ground cumin to the skillet.
4. Cook over medium heat until the onion is softened, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Add tomato sauce and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Stir in rinsed and drained black beans, chopped cilantro, salt, and pepper.
7. Lightly grease a 9-inch square baking dish with cooking spray.
8. Layer 4 tortillas in the bottom of the baking dish.
9. Spread one-third of the cheese over the tortillas, followed by one-third of the bean mixture.
10. Repeat layers two more times.
11. Sprinkle the reserved 2 tablespoons of cheese over the top.
12. Cover the baking dish and bake for 20 minutes.
13. Uncover and bake for another 10 minutes, or until bubbly and heated through.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a black bean and tortilla casserole in a rustic, earthenware baking dish. Style with vibrant chopped green onions and cilantro. Use warm, directional light to highlight the textures of the beans and melted cheese, with a shallow depth of field focusing on the center of the dish. Incorporate a dark, textured background and worn wooden props to create a comforting, inviting mood. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the layers of tortillas and filling.

video_script.title: Black Bean and Tortilla Casserole
video_script.description: A quick and easy vegetarian casserole recipe, perfect for a weeknight meal.

scenes.voice_over: Start by sautéing the garlic, onion, tomatoes, and green onions in a lightly greased skillet over medium heat for about 5 to 7 minutes, until the onion softens.

scenes.voice_over: Add the chili powder, cumin, and tomato sauce. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

scenes.image_prompt: The skillet with the bean mixture, showing black beans and cilantro being stirred in.
scenes.voice_over: Stir in the rinsed and drained black beans, chopped cilantro, salt, and pepper.

scenes.voice_over: In a greased baking dish, layer 4 tortillas, then one-third of the cheese and one-third of the bean mixture. Repeat layers twice more.

scenes.voice_over: Sprinkle the reserved cheese over the top.

scenes.image_prompt: The casserole baking in the oven, bubbly and golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Cover and bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for 20 minutes. Then, uncover and bake for another 10 minutes, or until heated through and bubbly.

scenes.voice_over: Serve hot and enjoy! This casserole is delicious on its own or with a side salad. Top with sour cream, Greek yogurt, or extra cilantro.

cooking_tips: For a spicier casserole, add a pinch of cayenne pepper or a few dashes of your favorite hot sauce to the bean mixture.
If you don't have low-fat cheddar cheese, you can use regular cheddar or a Mexican blend.
Serve with a dollop of sour cream or Greek yogurt, and your favorite toppings like salsa, guacamole, or shredded lettuce.

recipes.name: Buttered Cabbage and Egg Noodles with Peas
ingredients: Salt and freshly cracked black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Cook the egg noodles according to package directions.
Step 2: While the noodles are cooking, melt the butter and olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Step 3: Add the diced onions to the pan and sauté until golden brown, approximately 5-10 minutes.
Step 4: Add the shredded cabbage to the pan and cook until softened, approximately 15 minutes.
Step 5: Add the cooked egg noodles and frozen peas to the pan. Season generously with salt and freshly cracked black pepper.
Step 6: Cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring to combine, until the peas are heated through.
Step 7: Serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of buttered cabbage and egg noodles with peas in a shallow, rustic ceramic bowl.  Use soft, natural light to highlight the glistening butter and vibrant green peas against the creamy noodles and cabbage.  A shallow depth of field focuses on a twirl of noodles adorned with peas, while the remaining dish blurs gently.  Incorporate a linen napkin and weathered wooden background for a cozy, inviting mood.  Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh parsley and a few cracks of black pepper for visual interest.

video_script.title: Buttered Cabbage and Egg Noodles with Peas

scenes.text: Buttered Cabbage & Egg Noodles with Peas
scenes.voice_over: Craving a warm, comforting meal that's quick and easy to make?  Look no further! Today, we're making Buttered Cabbage and Egg Noodles with Peas. It's a simple dish packed with flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: egg noodles, green cabbage, onions, frozen peas, butter, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: Egg noodles, a head of green cabbage, onions, frozen peas, butter, olive oil, salt, and pepper.

scenes.image_prompt: Pot of boiling water with egg noodles being added.
scenes.voice_over: First, cook your egg noodles according to package directions.  Be sure to salt the water generously.

scenes.image_prompt: Large pan with butter and olive oil melting over medium-high heat.
scenes.voice_over: While the noodles cook, melt the butter and olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Diced onions being sautéed in the pan until golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Add your diced onions and sauté until they are golden brown and fragrant, which should take about 5 to 10 minutes.  Don't overcrowd the pan and use medium-high heat.

scenes.image_prompt: Shredded cabbage being added to the pan with the sautéed onions.
scenes.voice_over: Add the shredded cabbage to the pan. We're using about half a head which should be 1 to 1 1/2 pounds.

scenes.image_prompt: Cabbage cooking in the pan, wilting and softening.
scenes.voice_over: Cook the cabbage until softened, about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

scenes.image_prompt: Cooked noodles, peas, salt and pepper being added to the pan with the cabbage and onions.
scenes.voice_over: Now add the cooked noodles, the frozen peas, salt, and pepper to taste.

scenes.image_prompt: All ingredients being stirred together in the pan until heated through.
scenes.voice_over: Stir everything together until the peas are heated through. This only takes about 2 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a serving of Buttered Cabbage and Egg Noodles with Peas in a bowl, garnished with fresh cracked pepper. A fork is placed next to the bowl.
scenes.voice_over: Serve immediately. This dish is delicious on its own but also pairs well with a side of grilled chicken or fish. Each serving has approximately 350 calories, 12 grams of protein, 50 grams of carbs, and 15 grams of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra flavor, try adding a splash of vegetable broth or white wine to the pan with the cabbage.
If you prefer a richer dish, use half butter and half olive oil, or add a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese before serving.

recipes.name: Classic Buttered Egg Noodles
directions: Step 1: In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken bouillon cubes and 1/2 stick of butter. Stir until the bouillon cubes and butter are dissolved.

video_script.title: Classic Buttered Egg Noodles

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: egg noodles, butter, Wyler's chicken bouillon cubes, and a measuring cup with water.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: two Wyler's chicken bouillon cubes, one and a half cups of water, half a cup or one stick of unsalted butter, and eight ounces of dried egg noodles.

scenes.image_prompt: Medium saucepan filled with water being heated on a stovetop over medium-high heat. Bubbles are starting to form.
scenes.voice_over: First, bring one and a half cups of water to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat.
